text:
The food was good.
Corned beef hash was great!
Hash Browns should have been crisp,they were not.
Jam was great.
Service was worst ever. Waitress had no personality and no service. No refill on coffee, but she made sure she got a tip I paid the bill.
WILL NEVER GO BACK!!!!

Oh my goodness! I fell in love here! This place was not only affordable, but was DELICIOUS! The hash is home made! Also they make their own jams as well. I am a huge home made fan. Anything home made is always better. The portions were nice & big. Our server was very pleasant. It was pretty mellow when we went but I was very pleased. If you are in Vegas and looking for a great breakfast place that will cost you less than $25-30, for two people go here! I believe you won't be let down. I will be going there again when I visit Vegas.
The best old school cafe in Vegas! Been going for over 10yrs never a bad  experience. Like visting my favorite aunt's house.

It's one of Las Vegas hidden gems. It is off strip in a plaza near a barber shop. In the Decatur plaza. My husband ordered thick cut bacon eggs with home fries and sourdough toast with there homemade jam. You have to get toast to try there jams you will not be disappointed. Also ask Mary for some sweet tea she makes it from scratch just for you. This tea is unlike I have ever tasted before. Defiantly will be coming back for another visit.

I only gave this place one star because the home made jams was really tasty. My husband's soup was cold and there was a hair in my food. When it was time to pay we mentioned it to our waitress and got our food comped  wich was nice but no I'm sorry or anything. Customer service gose a long way.
Fantastic country breakfast. Love the homemade jam. Do not make the mistake of going to hash house a-go-go. This place is WAY better!

I don't know about some of the bad reviews but I've been going there for a few years and I've never had a bad experience. Awesome food, old school type restaurant! The thing about reviews is that some people set high expectations and it usually can't be met which turns them into bad customers...

We saw this place on Food Network's Chopped and had to check it out.
First time we went, I had the corned beef hash. Oh my goodness. I'll never be able to eat the canned stuff again. I was quite yummy, and there was so much of it!

The second time, I had the waffle. Was definitely not disappointed. I also tried one of their homemade jellies. Will definitely be ordering some off their website for the holidays.

The chef, Mary, even came out to talk with us. Very nice little local place to hit up when you want a break from the Strip and the insane food prices.

After searching every hotel/casino coffee shop menu online, as well as most of the local breakfast/lunch places, I finally found a place in town that makes a proper Monte Cristo sandwich!

This little place in the Decatur & Sahara area does the Monte Cristo as it should be done: Thinly sliced ham, turkey & Swiss cheese on french toast, batter-dipped, then deep fried.  For those of you who have never had one, it may sound a bit heavy, unhealthy, fattening, and it is all of that.  It's not something that you should really eat on a regular basis, I'm sure there are tons of calories in there, but every once in a while, it's a wonderful treat!

At Mary's it comes with your choice of a side dish for $8.95, a really good value for the amount of food that you get.  The only drawback for me was the fresh fruit that you can order as a side is always strawberries & bananas.  I would prefer the traditional fresh cantaloupe, honeydew and grapes that I've had at other places in the past.  Not a big deal in the grand scheme of things.

If your a fan of the Monte Cristo, do yourself a favor and check this place out.

the boss likes the corned beef hash and thinks it is some of the best in town so we gave it another chance. I tried the western omelette this time. It was fine, nothing special. I tried the homemade peach jelly and the pineapple jelly and both were good. The true problem with this place is the service. There is no other way to describe it except bad. Friendliness, refills, and checking in your clients just doesn't seem to be part of the waitresses job. The service makes for a very unejoyable experience.

I have been to many restaurants, usually I only post when there was something bad I experienced. This restaurant has done something that you don't usually experience nowadays. "Customer Service", i mean great customer service. We had our 1.5 year old niece with us, and the owner even let us use her kitchen to cook her food, since we were traveling. 
The food now...we had typical american breakfast at a lot of places, I would say it is good enough to compete with the other ones. The owner was featured in "Chopped", and she deserves to be there. The service was great, our waitress went over and above to make sure we got everything we wanted. The jam....man oh man, need to try that Jalapeño or Lemon jam...over all a must try if you're visiting Las Vegas... Thanks to the owner and our server..!!

I came here on a Tuesday and was blown away by both the food and service. Everything from my eggs, toast, hash, and bacon were perfectly cooked by Mary herself. The bread used for the toast was so delicious that I woke up thinking about it the next day. The array of jams and jellies that they serve are pure perfection. In the end, my husband and I ended up buying two jars (one raspberry the other apricot) to take home with us. 

There was only 1 waitress there that day. She put most big named restaurants to shame. She was sweet, attentive, and was able to work the whole room (all filled with locals that frequented the place daily). 
I will definitely come to eat here again when I am in Las Vegas.

I went here with my husband on Sunday at about 11am. The place was half empty, which should tell you something. We sat ourselves per the sign and grabbed our own menus. After about five minutes someone finally realizes we exist and the waitress takes our order. She greeted us by saying she was glad we were ready because she had a table of fifteen to get to. Okay... well yeah we're ready, we've been sitting here staring at the tiny menu for five minutes. I order and ask what the hash browns are like. "They're shredded." "Okay, are they crispy though?" "Yeah," she says in a huff. My husband orders the waffle special. After a million years, our order comes. My bacon and eggs were okay, not great. The "crispy" hash browns were mostly mush and tasted ENTIRELY of grease. Like no other flavor was present than straight up grease. My husband's teaspoon of eggs and two strips of bacon were also mediocre/okay (I gave him a few of my five slices of bacon). However his waffle was flavorless, served with a tiny shot flavorless syrup. I tried his waffle and couldn't even believe how the slightest hint of waffle flavor disappeared within milliseconds and left me chewing on a wet sponge. At some point while we were eating we were surprised by the sudden appearance of our check on the corner of our table. How did it get there? Did it float in on the breeze? Our waitress was nowhere to be seen. Which was too bad for us because we would have liked more napkins, water, and flavorless syrup. Oh well. I finished my meal by eating my toast with some of the jams, the apple butter was probably the best apple butter I've ever had, truly a star of a jam. That is why I gave 1 star to this place. If you come here you should just buy a jar of jam and leave. 

Finally, having never heard from our waitress again (someone nearby flagged her down for napkins which of course caused her to spin around and vanish into thin air), I got up and paid with the check that had been delivered to us by a ghost. To my surprise, there was our waitress talking to the cashier! She was passionately bitching about another customer to the cashier who seemed to try to politely ignore her. The cashier was friendly to me but in no way did I feel bad about leaving a minuscule tip to match the service. 

Ignore the good reviews! Eat somewhere else if you want to enjoy your breakfast in any way!

I came in here to order some french toast. The french toast was decent though I can't believe they serve soda in the can. The service sucks and sucks bad. I was the only person trying to order and I literally waited about 20 minutes before someone came and took my order.
We were looking for an off the strip place for breakfast. We got lucky and found this place.   Great homemade breakfast!   Don't miss it if you are in Vegas.

What an amazing down to earth real breakfast joint! I love the no bullshit good food atmosphere!!! It's nothing too special, I mean it's eggs and potatoes... But you feel special... Like your somewhere worth being.... The owner has been in several food network competition shows and is usually there.... It is busy often!!! The grits are my favorite!!! They make cinnamon rolls from scratch and they are good!!! Also, they make jams... My favorite is the jalapeño one!!! They serve lunch too.... But, I have only gone for breakfast!!!! I have been there so many time!!! You all should just go... It's just good...

I searched one $ cheap breakfast, looking for a place to sit and relax before a meeting. The Hash House popped up as a mile away so I decided to give it a try. Coffee and corned beef hash was $12.70. Service was great- I never had an empty cup. The food however was lackluster. I found myself adding all four of their in-house seasonings to try and bring up the flavor level. As far as I could tell, the ingredients were fresh and cooked perfectly; they just lacked seasoning. 
The menu is well rounded- with breakfast and lunch items. I will probably try one more time to see if it was just the corned beef hash.

All I can say is Mary's hash house is not just a a place for great food that won't leave you feeling heavy after breakfast. It's a dinner with that old American Midwest flavor. From the friendly personal service(Mary usually comes out and greets her guests.) To the random coffee mugs, the home made bread and the jams all made in house that make you feel at home. I've been going to Mary's for a long time and anyone I take with me just loves it. Highly recommended. In my opinion. It's the best breakfast in Las Vegas. Kudos to Mary for keeping it simple and keeping it fresh.

Not impressed... The food was sub par and the service was terrible! They seem understaffed and for a crowded restaurant on a Sunday morning 2 chicks weren't cutting it... I won't go back, breakfast was "eh" at best..

Came here on a recommendation from a friend, ordered the party hash with fresh fruit and toast.

The lady that sat and served me was pretty curt and uninterested, whereas she was chummin it with who I assume were some locals.  No biggie, as long as the food's good I can take or leave sociability to be honest.

Good, however, is not the word I finally chose to describe the food I consumed.  The party hash consists of everything in the super hash, with mushrooms and jalapenos to boot.  While I was eating, I found myself thinking, "if the party hash is this bland, how the hell must the super hash taste (without mushrooms and jalapenos)??"  After the hype (which could barely be qualified as "hype," maybe better described as mild promotion) it was a let-down.

Fresh fruit was some pitiful watermelon cuts and banana slices.  The jelly was VERY good (IMO the best thing about the place).  It was THE only aspect of our entire interaction that the server displayed any modicum of enthusiasm (not that I need some f*in Carrot-Top server, but she was definitely a downer).  In this though, she came to the table with a tray of jelly options and offered it to me for the toast.  It was impressive and delicious =D

Again, that really is the only good thing about the place.  It's called Hash House and I tried what was supposed to be one of the sig dishes, and yet I think my Pops enjoyed his biscuits and gravy much more than I enjoyed my meal.

If you're starving, and you're there, go ahead, but I'd probably try something OTHER than one of their hash dishes, and DON'T SKIP the toast and jelly

This place is delicious. Seriously, all comfort foods but not heavy and overly sugared or creamed. They work magic with their eggs, make sure you ask for scrambled with cheese. They have these home made cinnamon rolls that make you come back for more every time. Make sure you try the strawberry habanero jelly! Perfectly sweet with just the right amount of spice. All the waitresses are adorable, and probably the most friendly people I've ever met. I love coming here (:

Really awful. Came in at 11 am, sat down and left at noon without food. Sat in the seat facing the kitchen- witnessed our waitress picking (not scratching, digging deep) her nose then reaching for toast and arranging potatoes on a plate. Saw the 2 male cooks pushing each other and playing in the kitchen- swinging bacon around in the air and pushing each other's hats off (so they had to readjust their hats and scratch their faces without washing hands or changing gloves) before making French toast. I saw "Mary," apparently the owner, cooking eggs and wiping her nose/sweaty forehead on the back of her gloved hand- without changing gloves or washing hands. Saw my cottage cheese sitting out for more then half an hour without refrigeration and my husband's fries for more then 20 minutes without light/heat. Waited 15 minutes to let our cashier know (after the other had walked by us waiting at the register- she also ran into my chair really hard and just kept going while trying to serve people, after I spilled my coke from her knocking a leg on my chair- no apology or offer of a free coke, which they only have in bottles for crying out loud) we were leaving to pay for the coke, only to have a hand waved at us and told to just leave. We wanted to pay for the coke but we were so fed up we left. Hour and a half to be subjected to rude waitresses, unsanitary and dangerous food, and then treated like garbage.

It was my first time to eat hash.  The word "hash" in reference to food made me uneasy, but I must say, I really enjoyed it.  Very moist and flavorful.  The homemade jams were also very tasty.  Attentive and friendly service...all in all...Enjoyable!

So I read a few reviews before deciding to come here. A fan of chopped I figure it'd be worth a try. As we entered on Friday at 1pm, we were surprised by the lack of crowd. Three table of patrons.  We read the sign after dumbly standing there for a minute or two without anyone greeting us and we seated ourselves. Looking around we saw many tables with dishes not bused. We sat. And sat. And sat. No one came to greet us. The one and only server finally came and took order from a nearby table. Did not acknowledge us. We are a table of 7... Luckily I had time on my hands so I read more reviews. On one of them a reviewer mentioned "the egg and I"  nearby. We walked out without a goodbye.  We were famished. Luckily the egg and I seemed close by. Keep in mind this was a spur of the moment decision. Triggered by the lack of service at our original destination. We arrive at egg and was greeted by a smiley hostess. The place was crowded. We informed her we wouldn't mind two tables of four. She smiled and said she has just the space for us. They pushed two tables together and made us a space by the booths.  Service was prompt. Our waitress introduced herself as Jackie. The food was delicious. 
bottom line is the reviews seem to give the food good remarks. However we were turned off by the lack of service and never made it to the food part.  Even if the food was five star worthy, the overall experience would have netted 3 stars at best. Being a small business owner myself, my constructive criticism for the owner would be to over staff part timers so short staffing does not ruin the reputation of the establishment. The difference at your competitor was night and day. As a result we are a loyal egg and I customer at the moment

Whatever you do don't ask for a booth.  Wow talk about rudeness.  They closed the back area.  Which is where the booths are.  We asked to sit in a booth and the hostess told us that they were all closed. We asked her if we could please sit ten feet back in the closed area to sit in a booth.  She was very rude and said no. I told you that area is closed.  Having no interest in sitting at a table in the middle of the room we left.  She could have cared less. Sad. The waitress would have like our business and tip  I'm sure.

One of my most favorite breakfast spots in Vegas. Its never crazy crowded and I like that you can seat yourself. The staff is always so friendly and they never so busy that they forget you just walked in. I highly recommend the biscuits and gravy. Its usually on English muffins but the gravy itself it awesome!! I'm from Nashville so I'm pretty picky when it comes to gravy but this place got it right. Delicious!! The hash is amazing. I haven't had one I didn't like. The best part about this place is its small and cozy feeling and most important the food is great and doesn't break the bank to eat here.

I've been coming to Mary's for over 15 years. Mary, Martha, and Darlene are always friendly and the food is delicious! My favorite is the party hash with their jalapeno seasoning and smokin' habanero sauce on top. It's so good that it compelled me to write my first Yelp review!

This place is AMAZING!  I'm sooooo glad I found this spot!
Best breakfast / lunch in Vegas! Charming spot with a great staff! Mary is so sweet! She's created a wonderful dining experience.  I had the pleasure to share with her how I found her spot, (on YELP) and how much I enjoyed her food.  She is so humble and has a wonderful story as to how she developed her culinary talents.  Great lady! 
We loved it soooooo much, we came here for breakfast two days in a row...  Haha
Try the chicken and waffles with grits! Really really good!
Oh, the spicy chicken soup is AMAZING!

This place is an awesome mom and pop establishment. Everything was home made and delicious. The hashes are phenomenal,  I had traditional and my wife had lamb. Both were great. They have a selection of home made jams/jellies to die for. Would've given them five stars but when we asked the other waitress for napkins she  told our waitress to get it for us and just stood their while we waited for it and they weren't even busy.   Go eat here the food is good

Came here because my regular place by work was under construction. Ummmm walking in it looks like a totally dive, but don't let that fool you. 

Also, you might be melting while sitting in this place. It was probably at least 90 degrees in there. The atmosphere was pretty nasty, but the food was sooooo bomb!

Don't let the atmosphere throw you off. The food was excellent!

This is an awesome place for breakfast. It was not too big, not too noisy, fast service and food was delicious.  Its an old school family diner with their regulars. I had the vegetarian eggs benedict with potato fries. I ordered the hashbrowns but I didnt mind. What made the meal was the homemade jams on the yummy bread and all of them were fantastic. I sprinkled the jalapeno spice on the table and I stopped talking to finish my food. Good sign.

For a girl who's trying to maintain her size 4, this place's corned beef hash makes it down right hard.  Their corned beef hash is the best in town.  It's homemade.  Their jams are also homemade and very yummy.  I've been going here for years and the owners are just the sweetest things.  It's a cozy family restaurant and you can taste the love in their corned beef and homemade jams.  

I do agree with some of the other reviewers regarding service.  It's a hit or miss.  It really depends if they are busy or not.  But don't let it discourage you from going.  This is place is a total find.

But if I only had $20 and I had to choose a breakfast spot.... sorry Hash House, I truly like your corned beef hash but that darn Cracked House, um I mean Cracked Eggs wins.

The food is great. They have delicious cinnamon rolls, hot chocolate,and coffee. They have a lot of food to eat and choices to choose from, but they have a pretty low food supply they ran out of steak at 9:30am.

Waited 10 minutes, we had to call the waitress over ourselves. just to have the waitress tell us she would come right back so we asked for water because we had already been waiting 10 minutes. And 10 minutes later and the waitress never bought out our water so we left. AWFUL SERVICE

Mary and her staff have always made me feel right at home.  I make sure when I'm in town to stop by and have the "usual"  Darlene will always ask whoever I bring in "why'd you bring her"  and they always get a big laugh out of that.  
The Hash is no where as greasy as most Hash is and it is very flavorful.  Mary is definitely old school diner mentality  she loves to cook and you will never walk in there and not see a smile on her face

While there's no super innovative fusion dishes everything was made/executed with "love".  Proper crunch/golden-brown crisped edges on home fries with seemingly freshly chopped veggies (ie not pre-processed in some faraway Sysco factory).

Properly cooked/crispy bacon chunks topped my Mary's Bendict along with soft (again) well-executed poached eggs and (yes, again) seemingly in-house made gravy.

Friends' omelettes and hashes were all super-well received.  Fruit (bananas and strawberries) was even seemingly fresh cut.

Service was great.  Perfect getaway from the sometimes zombie/mass-prepared food of the Strip.  Driving through/around Asia-town also allows for banh-mi or dumplings pick up.
Absolutely delicious. Get something you would not normally get (I got the lamb hash) and you will not be disappointed! Great ambience and service.

I absolutely did not like this place and wish the 'Food Network' revisited to take away its credentials "As seen on Chopped".  We initially went to another nearby restaurant that we love, however, the wait was 25 minutes and since we were starving, we decided to try this restaurant.  The hostess told us 10 minutes but we ended up waiting twice as long. There wasn't any seating so we were forced to stand for that time with our active infant.  5 tables left and still we weren't seated because no one cleaned those tables off. The environment was old and unkempt.  The candy in the entrance was so old that I'm surprised they didn't notice.  My infant sat in a run down, un-assembled high-chair dated from 1989 and not fastened by buckles, but a mans waist belt.   Finally we ordered but I wish the waitress went over the menu because my meal wasn't what I expected.  The food was bland, mushy and oily, the waitress was aloof, I had to ask for more water and the lady behind us asked twice for a to-go box.  I hated my meal so much that I didn't eat it; first time I've ever not eaten a meal ordered.  HORRIBLE SERVICE, DEPRESSING FOOD and environment.

Really enjoyed this place. Very mom and pop feeling. 
Great food, very clean and good service
The corned beef hash was the best I've had! The service was excellent. We will definitely be back the next trip in town!
I come here often. They have great food. Love the selection of jellies, but raspberry is the best. Prices are very affordable. Mary's is great.

This place is nothing to write home about.  Hidden away in a corner of the shopping mall near Decatur and Sahara, one would almost miss it if they weren't already trying to track it down.  As the restaurant is only open till 2pm, if you take too long to find it, you won't make it in time.

When we entered the restaurant, we found our table and the waitress dropped off the menu's without asking us if we'd like something to drink.  This would be understandable if it was slammed in the restaurant.  We were one of two or three tables occupied, however, so this with the fact that it took her another 10-15 minutes to return diminished our hopes of an enjoyable meal.

I am one to believe that a restaurant should not be entirely judged on one particular meal alone.  Much like Lotus of Siam, where it is said the Northern Menu is what the restaurant is best known for, the Hash here is supposed to be excellent.  I, however, am not a big fan of hash so I chose to not eat it (as well it was lunch).  The food that we did order (the Peasant Lunch was my choice) was decent but again, a bowl of chili, plain toast and a small cup of strawberries and banana's did not seem to be worth $6.99.

Between the two Hash House moniker's, I would recommend A-Go-Go.  Forget about the looks of either place...at A-Go-Go, the food is better all around (I don't have to limit myself to one particular type of food) and the portions are huge.  If I want a small, decently cooked home-made meal, I'll go to the 50's Diner on Jones near the 215 or Black Bear Diner on Jones and Tropicana.  Both are much more appropriate choices with better service and decent food.
The good was so delicious and fresh. I had the fried chicken and waffles omg thee best!!!! Repeat is a must!!!!
Awesome meal. Great staff and owner interaction.  Cinnamon rolls out of this world. And home made jellies so delicious.

This place is pretty good. They make their own jams and they were all amazing, I had the waffle which was also good. I loved that it was easy to eat and not too crunchy.  They have amazing cinnamon roll flavored anything as well.

like others before us-we were trying to go to hash house a go go!!! but who knew we had to specify between 3 different places (now that there is one on the strip)....but anyways-it was TINY!!! and the staff was very homely...buuutttttttt think about it-why are you going there?? for a good breakfast and they didn't disappoint....i ALWAYS order my hash browns extra crispy and this was the first time in my entire life that they were actually cooked to crispyness....prices were great...i mean-who doesn't love paying 'normal' prices for stuff in vegas!!! idk if i would go back but you won't leave disappointed!

The meal I just ate was one of the best I have ever had. Their Cinnamon Roll French Toast is to die for... And everything else I had with the meal was good too. Old school feel with amazing food. YOU HAVE TO GO TO THIS PLACE

My family enjoys "hole in the wall" type restaurants. And this place, although at a strip mall, has that type of feel with random framed pictures and various bird decorations all around. Service may be a little slow, but the staff is very nice.

There are no kid menus but the servers can rattle the items offered by memory.

We had the homemade cinnamon roll fresh from the oven. Not too sweet and you can taste the cinnamon.

Oatmeal came with warm milk & brown sugar. Simple but satisfying.

The Iced Coffee was tasty as well as their coffee which came in medium or strong. We tried the medium and it was "ok." It had a different aftertaste to it.

They had homemade jellies. Yummy!

The waffles were tasty.

The biscuits and gravy were good but could have used a little more salt.

The bacon was awesome.

We asked for hard boiled eggs but they could only make poached.

Overall, if you want a satisfying breakfast, I would recommend that this place is worth a try.

Mary's hash house, not to be confused with hash house a go go, is terrible.  This place has the worst service I've ever seen.   I would love to tell you our servers name but she never said hello or introduced herself, she just said "drinks?"  We ordered two iced tea. About 10 minute minutes later she came over, put our drinks down in front of us and just looked at us with a pen and pad.  No suggestions, no "what are you having," she just looked us.  I had to ask her if she was ready, to which she responded with a shrug, as if I was wasting her time.  Mind you there where only 3 other tables with people at them in the whole place.  I should have know at that point that a breakfast joint with 6 other people in it on a Saturday morning was not the place to be.  Food took about 10 minutes, the check was dropped with the food and the server never returned.  We sat there with empty glasses for the rest of the meal.  I had the corned beef hash, my friend had the roast beef hash.  Both were ok, not great by any means but not bad either.  I read a few other reviews that said the hash was great compared to the canned stuff they are used to.  That right there should tell you everything you need to know about the food.  Back to service, the next time I saw our server she went up to the bar counter where they had what looked like cinnamon buns in glass presentation cases.  She opened up the glass presentation cases, and squeezed the buns with her bare hands to check the freshness.  Well I would say after that I had enough.  I wanted to try the "homemade deserts" but no one ever came back to check on us or to see if we needed anything else.  Also, after seeing how the handle the food out front where everyone can see imagine what's going on behind closed doors in the kitchen. I took our check to the unattended register, and stood waiting for someone to show up and cash me out, I should have just left, but being a bartender here l in town I wouldn't do that.  Our server showed up to cash me out, and just like at the table 30 minutes earlier she never said a word.  Not a "how was everything," not a "thank you," no "come back again," nothing.  So I can assure you I will never return Mary's hash house!!!

If you have a car and want a local breakfast/brunch away from the Strip you MUST put Mary's on your list.  Great service, food (brisket hash) and prices.  What a find I will definitely keep Mary's in my navigation's address book and plan to return whenever we return to Vegas.
We had great service and good food. We like to eat at locally owned restaurants. Mary cooked our breakfast we could not ask for more.

Another new breakfast place for us.  A real positive was that it is out of our area and as usual we arrived late, but there was no line or wait.  In fact at about 10:00 am it was "seat yourself." 

Usually don't have hash for breakfast but this is a hash house after all, so why not.  I had the lamb hash and it was pretty good. The menu describes the lamb as "Cabernet Sauvignon marinated leg of lamb with notes of rosemary," which I suppose should make it extra special.  But I guess my palate is too old and not sensitive enough to detect the subtlety of what they advertise.  In my opinion this isn't the kind of place or meal that should be describing or described by "notes" of anything. However, the lamb taste was there and the hash was good. My wife had the corned beef hash which she enjoyed but didn't find exceptional.  

The service was excellent.  The staff was hustling all the time but our waitress didn't forget us and kept our coffee cups full.  And the coffee she delivered was very good.
Nice diner atmosphere.  Good food, raspberry cream cheese roll was delicious,  friendly staff! Awesome to eat away from the strip.
Awesome food, nice detail to the small touches. You can tell the owner is an old school foodie. I had the ham hash- id have it again!

This is complicated.  I was there last week for a late breakfast.  First of all their portions are huge.  I took my Dad, he has gotton the pancakes, huge and delicious.  I decided to go with the cornbeef hash.  It was really boring, not too bad of taste but just not very memorable and I think it may have been sitting.  The service is excellent and I did see they have fried chicken and waffles yummy, which is what I am going to try next time.  I liked it here, but I think I'll like it more once I order something that really gets my eye.  I recomend it but stay away from the corned beef hash, not nasty but just not worth it.

Short story: come here for slow, crappy service and sub-par food.

Long story: Not knowing any better, I figured we would give Hash House a try given the 1 hr wait at the HHAGG. Big mistake. 

Walking through the door, I get the feeling this is my kind of place--  homey, seat yourself, etc. (In reality, it was actually like stopping for breakfast at my ex-mother-in-law's house after I ran over her cat. But I really don't have an ex-mother-in-law nor did I run over her cat.)

But back to breakfast-- after we seat ourselves, we wait 5 minutes before we are handed menus. (Were we supposed to grab them ourselves, I wonder? Possible faux pas which I will own.) But I think the icy stare from the owner/waitress was unnecessary and you could have asked for our beverage order...or just greeted us...anything. 

Coffee seems to take forever to arrive, and while we are waiting to order, I realize that the folks at two other tables have been/are still waiting for their food. (I thought folks were wrapping up their meal, but the fatigue on their faces was not from being overstuffed, it was from malnourishment.)

Now, based on other reviews, you might think that we were here on a particularly busy morning or something. Something, anything rational to explain the long wait for food. No, I think it has to do with a kitchen staff (actually I only saw 1 guy) who is not a short order cook. It looked like he was preparing 1 plate at a time...and slowly.

I order the corned beef hash, my wife picks the salmon and eggs. (She admitted she was delusional.) While the hash may be made to order, it was unremarkable. My wife's salmon was overcooked beyond recognition and yet, her eggs and home fries were cold. We tell our server and ask her to take it off the bill (because my wife will kill someone if she has to wait for something else to come out of the kitchen). 

So we get the bill, and surprise, she didn't charge for the salmon. (Reflecting back, I did say that the salmon was overcooked and we didn't want it... I did not say that we don't want to pay for the cold eggs and home fries...what was I thinking.)

OK, so I realize this is your livelihood and you can't just give away food the same way you do at a buffet (or Denny's) but do you see how it might be a bit offensive to charge for the barely edible food on the plate that was not sent back? Like we go around sending food back so we can get a meal comped... 

Lesson learned-- never eat here again. Even if the HHAGG has an hour wait. 

P.S. I hear HHAGG has a second location in Imperial Palace... I would go to the strip before going back to the craptastic Hash House.
We ALWAYS come here when we're in Vegas. We recommend it to every one and always bring our friends here. It's better than a hotel restaurant and waaay cheaper for delicious homemade food.

This is the best breakfast/ brunch place in Vegas and if you're in town anywhere near hear you have to give this place or forever feel that you have missed the best chance for the best homemade jellies and everything here is homemade so give this place a chance. If you come here you will figure it out " why I come all the way here from downtown Henderson.

Decided to come here with a few friends who enjoy the breakfast craze in our city.  Saw it on chopped and how it was a local business, variety of jellies etc....  Well the food needs its own flare of seasoning.  Its prepared well and the portions are great but the Lamb hash was short the tastey factor.  This is all fixed easily by their awesome selection of sauces.  Habanero ketchup, chipotle sauce, all fresh made.  The thing that needs serious attention is the lack of service.  Our server was sweet and got our order right but she had the whole restaurant and the help of one buser.  Jellies were great and the food ample, but hire more wait staff and give your chef freedom to season. THAT IS ALL
Great home-made corned beef hash and eggs. Terrific service and tasty dishes.  A place to enjoy a delicious breakfast!

Old school diner atmosphere with excellent service. Came here for the Monte Cristo and I must say it was the best one I've ever had. Ever! They took their time with this menu item and premake the sandwiches the night before. It was served with breakfast potatoes, which I asked if they were little cut potatoes-perhaps seasoned and the waitress said yes. Breakfast potatoes here means bland french fries. That wasn't great, but I wasn't there for sides.  I wish it wasn't so far from where we live so I could come here more often just for the Monte Cristo.

I gotta say, after reading some of the reviews, I came here expecting to have a descent meal & friendly service. Unfortunately I left the cafe not so happy and kinda disappointed. I'm gonna make my reasons short & sweet: depressing & gloomy atmosphere, no garlic in my chicken garlic hash, chipped water glass & last but not the least the food server who was neither friendly nor attentive. She never smiled, checked on my table, dropped the check with food & disappeared. The price was ok as well as quality of the food. In a city like Vegas with thousands of dining options, one would think small businesses like that go beyond their way to make costumes enjoy their experience. It one sentence, felt like dining at a truck stop in the middle of nowhere with a grumpy server who hates her job.

Poor service....slow and got both our orders wrong. Took so long to get our food it was cold and we just decided to make the best of it. The salsa is hot hot hot,lol. Not mild. So beware. The chicken salad I ordered had so much salt on it I almost gagged. The omelette my gf ordered had some sort of velvet cheese on it. Was not real cheese and was Luke warm at best. I did try their apple butter jam and that was very good. So one star for the jam. AVOID.

i've tried this place 3 times - i want to like this place, no, actually, i want to luv this place - like the maple tree, jamm's, Lou's, etc, i have a soft spot in my heart for local diner/breakfast spots and i want them to not only succeed but to have GREAT FOOD.

Big surprise, the hash house specialty - HASH.  They also have homemade breads and jellies.  I get the combo hash ( several meats mixed together ) and some rye bread.  The rye bread is good, the jelly - eh, ok but honestly,  ain't big on jellies to begin with - i prefer the bread for sopping up the tidbits.

the hash - boring for me - the portions are very "controlled" a definite no-no for me at a diner type place.   the cost - damn i forget - definitely under $10 including the coffee.

Overall, the food is ok but give me maple tree, black bear, jamms and if hash is your thing, i think a go-go is much more creative.

What a funny little find in Vegas. We decided to forego much of the standard "Vegas" experience in favor of a look into the real Vegas, where the locals go for good food.

We stumbled across this place and I'm so glad we did. The strip mall location and decor aren't anything to write home about, but I had a killer omelet and some MUCH needed strong dark roast coffee. I love that they give you the option of regular and STRONG coffee, and it's not the usual swill you get at most diners. 

I'll be back on my next Vegas trip, this is a great find.

Yes this place is absolutely our "Must Have Breakfast" spot whenever we are in Vegas!! We always order the Corn Beef Hash, best i've ever had! I must say though, since Yelp, this hole in the wall spot has become extremely popular (or shall I say crowded). The last time we were here, the waitress was a bit overwhelmed with customers however, she did handle it like a champ :)

Should've just stopped at McDonald's. SLOW service and unfriendly waitress. Any request was answered with a sour look. Took so long for the food to come and it was not anything special. The table next to us was sitting with dirty plates and old food the entire time we were here. Will not go back.

DO NOT come here. 
Service was unfriendly and slow. Drove out of way to come here based on reviews. 
Ordered one of their "specials" it was one the worst breakfasts I've ever had. I politely asked if I could just order a side of eggs. 
Waitress wouldn't even stop to talk to me. 
I don't ever leave bad reviews but customer service is still important to some.
Delicious fresh food. Came here on a Monday and they had great service! Loved the apple butter Jamm and blueberry oatmeal My fiancé had the chicken hash and he loved it!

I love this place! We've been coming to Mary's since before she moved to this location. We followed her here, we love it so much. 

When I was on Weight Watchers, there were lots of options that are standard on the menu for light eating. But don't get me wrong, this place has some extremely satisfying home cooked meals, too!

I came for their strawberry waffle, with this high hope for a fresh strawberry, homemade whipped cream, wonderful homemade strawberry jam/syrup, sweet waffley-greatness.
 The waffle was plain in taste, along with the strawberry  "sauce" was nothing but that nasty thick red compote. On top of it was $10 HAHA. 
 So if I ever try this place again it'd be for their homemade hash that people are raving about. Hopefully all their tlc is in that.
Great experience!! Excellent food and service for good price!! I love the relaxed atmosphere!!

Reasonably priced breakfast/brunch food. Came here with 2 other people and was immediately seated on a Sunday at around 10 AM.

We all ordered different types of hash. We got the traditional corned beef hash, the special steak hash, and the party hash. 

All 3 hashes were homemade and very delicious. (4 stars): 
The steak and tradtional corned beef hash came with 2 eggs any style, hashbrowns or homefries, and toast. the party hash came with scrambled eggs mixed in with the hash and toast. 

The best part of the toasts were the homemade jams. They had watermelon, raspberry, strawberry and other flavors. 

This spot is great if you like hashes! mary herself even stopped by!

If you're looking for homemade, huge portions of delicious breakfast, this is your spot. I came here right before we were about to leave to go back home, and trust me, I did not want to leave. I ordered the party hash, which really was like a party in my mouth. My cousin ordered a side of the pancakes, which were a stack of crispy-on-the-edges-and-super-fluffy goodness. There was only one server on the floor (it was a weekday) and she was very patient and kind with us as we were having trouble with deciding on what to order. As I went over to the restroom, I noticed a little window that peeked into the kitchen, and I was actually able to recognize Mary back there, cooking! I even saw her ask a couple customers how they really wanted their eggs. That's when you know you're eating fresh, quality homemade breakfast/brunch.

First time here at Mary's Hash house. Very slow service!!! French toast was a slice a bread with powder sugar and was cold. Butter did not melt. Told the waitress and she put it in the microwave!
Very dissatisfied!!! Will try again and give it another shop but my first experience was NOT to impressive!!

I had the corned beef and hash, and it was pretty good, not amazing though... because it was a little dry.

My friends had the eggs and bacon breakfast and said it tasted like eggs and bacon (which is always a good sign).

Things that are awesome are the home made jellies in all different flavors (and I mean ALL DIFFERENT flavors like Sangria, Mandarin, Habanero, etc.), so you've got to try them out.  Also, their home made chipotle sauce is amazing

The spicy ketchup is more sweet than spicy, but that may have just been the batch that we got.

The juices come in a plastic bottle, so I am not so much a fan--I prefer fresh squeezed orange juice, or at least concentrate in a glass... 

If the orange juice was better and the hash was less dry, this would be a five star; the jellies and home made sauces are the life savors for this place.

It's a little out of the way, but worth it to avoid the mess of the strip on Sunday morning.
Seriously awesome food. Really slow service- but well worth the wait. Best biscuits and gravy I've ever had in a restaurant. Homemade jams and jellies. Yum!

OMG the video is sooooooooo gooood!  You have to watch the video they posted.  And you have to go eat here!  It's my favorite breakfast place in Vegas.  My roommate is also obsessed with this place.  The staff has mostly been there for years so they are now all friends of ours we go visit a couple times a week.

If you are alone, sit at the bar.  I have had some of the most interesting conversations with strangers at that bar.  

Always ask for the specials and make sure you wave at Martha, Darlene and Mary for me. :)

Amazing hash! If you are looking for a friendly local breakfast or brunch diner then search no further. This place serves excellent food at reasonable prices. They are head and shoulders above that hash house a no no chain.

I completely understand why the show "Chopped" rated this breakfast and brunch place so highly. The food is fresh and very tasty and the service is very good as well...  Only a few miles off the strip, it's an easy drive and well worth it....

I love going to Mary's Hash House, not to be confused with the mediocrity of the chain Hash House a Go-Go. This is a little Vegas Gem that I enjoy seeing busy and like to tell people about.
    It's a no frills kind of joint (none of the coffee mugs match, which gives it extra charm to me) with excellent food! I go for the Corned Beef Hash, which is really something special in this world! They also make a killer Monte Cristo that is my second go-to. Upon straying from the hash, everything else I've tried has been quite tasty. Don't skip on the sides either. The grits are so so delicious, as well as the homemade jams!

Didn't want to eat in a casino. 
So I didn't. 
This was so nice.
Lovely staff. 
Homemade jellies. 
I had the jalapeno jelly and raspberry.
Wow.
Really good bottomless filter coffee.
I am so lonely.
This was respite.
OK, sure, there's a TV on. Somebody said that. That's fine. You're not there to eat the TV.

-Ron
Came in today to have two orders of biscuits and gravy with my girlfriend breakfast was good coffee was good service was good we'll be back again.
Super hash was amazing.  Big assortment of fresh jelly's and awesome spicy ketchups.   Will definitely be back.
Great food, great service, amazing homemade jam. Even bought some to take home. Will definately come back when I'm back in Vegas.
Place is old school..with great service and awesome food..and homemade jelly  and homemade cinnamon rolls!

Home food made to order. Cute little spot. Not too busy with quick service. 

Crowds are always annoying and it's good to find a small quiet spot to enjoy your late breakfast. 

Bacon toast and eggs!
Strawberry waffle and loads of homemade jelly! 

Lemon jelly for the win!

Service can make or break a place, and my experience here was lack there of. From the moment I entered, I waited a few minutes to be told , "can't you read seat your self. I sat myself and the older lady waitress with dark hair plopped down the menu on my table. Really??? Walked away and came back she said "so u ready to order" placed my order , only waited a few minutes for my monte cristo to arrive , she served it and walked away, no conversation at all. I could only eat half so after sitting for 5 minutes while she placed silverware on the other tables she glanced at me rolled her eyes and went back into the kitchen. 5-10 minutes pass as I'm just sitting there starring at the walls thinking any minute now she will offer me a box. Nope , didn't  happen she came back still nothing. I said can I please have a box and my check, very politely and she sighed, plopped my box and the check. Really!!!? Not once did she ask me how was everything or if i needed anything. There was no service. It made me feel like why did I even come here ! Not once did I complain or was I a hard time. I really don't get how severs who don't give a little service have jobs.
Now the reason I didn't give 1 star only was the food was pretty good 3-4 stars for tasty food.
0 for not having human decency in service!

Fresh eggs! Home cooking! Great coffee! Isn't Mary's 35 th anniversary with her husband today , so she made his favor cookies! Yummmmmmmyyyyy! Mary came out and said hi and made sure everything was perfect, between cooking! Love this place!

This place was recommended by a friend's co-worker and it did not disappoint. Pancakes with their jams were amazing! It was hard to choose which jam to get but the ones we did try were all really yummy! Good portions sizes as well and the service was really nice!
Very good breakfast. And very affordable. Came here 3 times while in the area. They have lots of options in thrir menu. Lots of paking available there.

Within the past six weeks, I renewed a love affair with HH, that started years ago when they were located on Spring Mountain.  I often wondered what had become of this wonderful Hash House until I located it on yelp.  There is was...the geographical location had changed but not the delicious chow, I remembered from yesteryear.  

The new location offers a much larger dining area with the same waitress from days gone by running around serving hungry eaters.  Be patient with her, the food is worth it, even if the same lady (owner, Mary, I think) is not slaving away on the griddle.

The name of the game is HASH.  There are multiple variations to try.  My favorite is the party hash....not the kind you might be thinking because it would illegal but the edible persuasion.  It's got a little bit of everything, corned beef, roast beef, ham, chicken jalapeños, with mushrooms, all scrambled together.

If your a fan of jelly, they have homemade jelly here.  All sorts of delicious flavors to choose from.  I like the jalapeño flavor is sweet and sassy.

After writing this I am filled with a warm fuzzy and I am going to throw down another star!  This is not a commercialized monster you are bound to find in ever state while traveling down a major interstate.  It is a wonderful LOCAL restaurant, you should try for an awesome breakfast!!

I have been to the Hash House before and LOVED it. The food is soooo good but sadly this time I am only giving it 2 stars, and they are lucky to get those. We came in on Sunday 8/17 around 11:30am. It was past the breakfast rush and before the lunch rush. I don't know if it was just our server but my goodness the service was TERRIBLE. We seated ourselves as the sign requests. There were MANY empty tables yet the first thing our server told us was how busy it was. We looked around very confused, but whatever maybe they were short staffed. NOPE I counted three servers in a very small restaurant should be plenty.  

It took us about 10 mins just to get coffee, which we desperately needed. Once we got the coffee I had to wait another 5 mins for the milk for the coffee. I finally gave up and went to the counter to get the milk. My server appeared to have forgotten. Since we knew this was already off to a bad start we all figured out what we wanted quickly and ordered as soon as we could get our servers attention. 

Getting a refill on coffee was literally like pulling teeth. We noticed the two (yes only two) other tables that were occupied commenting on how long it was taking, that they were just going to leave and so on. We were hungry so we stayed. After waiting a significant time one of my friends asked our server if our food would be out soon. Honest to goodness she looked like she either didn't know what we were talking about or was put off by us asking. She replied, "Oh, I don't know. I will go see." I am sorry...what?????

After she "went to go see" our food was brought out not 5 mins later. It wasn't super hot so maybe it had been sitting there...I don't know. Anyways, the food was just as good as I remembered. The jams are sooo good. The apple and raspberry jams are amazing. I am super bummed to give the Hash House a bad review, but dang that service was NO GOOD. Get it together guys, great food is well...great, but terrible service can kill a restaurant.

Go here.  Food is dynamite.  The hashes, the biscuits, the housemade sausage--all incredible.  Oh, and the cinnamon rolls.  Plus, a huge variety of homemade jellies.  Went here twice during a 4 day trip to Vegas.  Delicious.

I'm not a morning person or a breakfast person, but I can be persuaded to do a lot if my first stop is at Hash House. Not to be confused with HAGG, up the road, this place actually has good food and service.

Besides the hashes (just get the party hash that combines everything, watch out for the jalapenos, and you're good to go), there are omelets and my favorite dish, Mary's Eggs- which is Mary's take on eggs benedict. Two poached eggs on biscuits, topped with gravy and the best crispy bacon  you've ever had.
Everything is sided with homemade grits (simply perfect with butter) and a bowl of fresh fruit.

Their lunch options include soups, salads, and sandwiches. Monday's cream of mushroom is my personal favorite, but they're actually all pretty solid. Only open til 2PM, so run in and grab your order to go if you need to.

Mary's is a great spot for breakfast that's off the strip.  Its located in a strip mall with plenty of parking.  The interior is a bit dated but not too bad.  Our sever was great and so was the food.  If you want to get away from the crowds to have a great quiet breakfast Mary's is the spot.
Absolutely fabulous!! Home made jams (the apple butter is to die for). The best cuts of bacon. Friendly staff, nice bold coffee with flavored creamer! A must visit!

One of our favorite places to go. It's not on the menu but the Lobster Benedict is one of the best and there's something about their white, buttered toast and home made jams that are heavenly. Love this place.

We ate here on a Thursday afternoon.  The restaurant had just a couple of other patrons but the service was super slow.  We had to grab a busser, it seems, to take our order.  My husband ordered the sage chicken.  It was enormous.  The presentation was quite impressive. The flavor was pretty good, too.  

Our orders, however, didn't arrive simultaneously.  I hate that.  Would you believe I didn't receive my Caesar salad until 10 minutes after my husband's order arrived  Very irritated.

The servers were friendly but they never checked on us either.
One of my favorite places to eat breakfast when we are in Las Vegas. Hard to beat fresh out of the oven cinnamon rolls. Homemade corn beef is amazing. Everybody is very nice.
If you're visiting order a Hash. Makes sense since that is the name...I had Blueberry pancakes and they were meh. The corned beef hash was fab. So was the cinnamon rolls.

Came to Vegas for vacations, and found this place... brought  the whole family and we all loved it.. super yummy, prices and portions are very reasonable, will definitely come back here on my next visit to Vegas

Whats not to love?

Its clean, service is super fast, we love Darlene, one of the waitresses, she and I have this special relationship   ;)    hehe..

The food is always spot on, I always have the homemade sausage patty but my ex tried the Belgium waffle and that was amazing so next time I think I may venture out a bit.

Love their homemade jellies, we havent been in a while but need to make a point to return more often, it really is one of my favorite places and the owner, Mary will come out and greet you.  she really cares about people.    :)

I don't know which came first, this place or Hash House A Go Go but I made the mistake of coming here thinking it was the latter.  

Food wasn't spectacular, got one of the hashes that wasn't too flavorful.  The hash browns came out a bit raw, I like my hash browns with a crisp.  Nothing special but good portions.  

There are better breakfast places out there

Very tasty food, very affordable. Amazing jams, amazing chicken fried steak. Super tasty toast, crunchy bacon. Wheelchair and children friendly.

Heads up! It's worth noting that if you have any special eating accommodations, ask in detail and clarify first. In our  scenario, "real" maple syrup is required for my waffles, and they said they said they had it. But, it was maple flavored corn syrup. The chef came out and gave us another, different meal fortunately. 

In summary: very tasty, affordable, great volume, staff are good. If you're super picky, be very specific. This is not a casino restaurant - it's a homey tasty niche in Vegas! Come with homey tasty expectations :)
You start with seating yourself. Besides the long wait to place your order the place is typically busy with very good mostly homemade food. Food is not to salt or overly done. Simple and tasty
Delicious!  A wonderful restaurant with everything you want in a classic breakfast place!

Mary's Hash House experience was unusual. Definitely a hole in the wall diner. Upon arriving, my partner and I noticed dishes piled high against the wall of the bar area, at the tables in the main room, and later, we discovered the same at every empty table in the second dining room that we were seated at. We waited for at least 5 minutes along side two other groups of people for someone to welcome us. I believe it was Mary herself who added us to a waiting list, and told us it would be about 10 minutes before they would be able to clean off a table for us. We watched as the waitstaff wandered around the dirty tables as in a state of confusion, and never saw a dedicated buser the entire time we were there. We had plenty of time to review the menu while waiting at the front, so when we were sat, we ordered everything immediate, in hopes to speed up the process. We were sitting among dirty tables the entire time , which made us feel uneasy, and our order took forever. The food was good, but not great, and with the dirty tables all around us, we didn't feel like we could enjoy our food. We were perplexed, considering both of us have worked in the service industry, and have experienced busy periods during our shifts. Looking around, it didn't appear to be that busy, just a totally unorganized older waitstaff. The jalapeño jam was bright and delicious. Strangely enough, the jam was brought around in a tray that resembled a Jell-O shot tray, so that added to the uniqueness of that odd place. I'm not going back, and I certainly would not recommend this place to friends. We waited 50 minutes for our food, and the diner wasn't even half full at any point during our time there.

Horrible, awful food!!!  Enough jalapenos in their chorizo to top an entire plate of nachos.  The eggs were well cooked but the chorizo was awful.  My husband had the mushy corned beef hash with eggs.  Not at all crispy.

Love this place when I'm in Vegas! Good prices! OMG there jelly selection mmmmmmmmmmm!!! I had to buy a jar to bring back with me to L.A. They close at 2pm better get up by 12pm....lol!! Everything is great on the menu! Hopefully I will visit soon Mary's Hash House

When you first arrive you seat yourself, which is normally fine if the place has waiters who are ready and able to greet and serve customers (spoiler, this place doesn't). Instead, waiters, or waitresses, couldn't be bothered with such nonsense, and seem to want as little to do with you as possible. When I went with my wife, HH was in no way busy. When our waitress got around to our table, she was visibly in a rush and even said she had other tables to get to. Good thing we had been sitting there for a bit and were ready to order. After an even longer wait for our food to arrive, we were presented with food that couldn't compete with even the lowliest of diners. My waffle was literally, and I literally mean literally, tasteless. And the shot of syrup they give you does nothing to help.
 My wife said her hash browns mainly consisted of grease; she ordered them specifically to be more crispy. 
Again, our waitress could not have less to do with us if she tried. Randomly, in the middle of eating she quickly placed the check down on the corner of the table and darted off. She never once asked how the food was. She never once offered us anything else. She never once even asked if we need more water.
Long story short, avoid this place. This is not one of those cool, hole in the wall places. This is a one star restaurant with one star service and one star food.
Do yourself a favor, stay at home and make your own breakfast. Even if you can't cook, you'll at least be treated better.
for great comfort food this is the gem of in las vegas ..... only open for breakfast & lunch 6am to 2pm.

This place is a hidden gem!  I would have never found it without Yelp. Food is maybe the best brunch food I've had in Vegas! I had the brisket hash YUM! Their homemade jelly was tasty. We decided raspberry was our favorite. Service was perfect. It's a clean, homey, friendly, little place. I can't wait to go back!

Feel like I'm at home here. Love the service and the food is great. Breakfast is always great especially all the different hash options and fresh jams. I had a Reuben today and saved half of it for dinner. Portions size excellent

I decided to try the hash house after seeing the commercials in our hotel room. Unfortunately, it was not the same place I seen on TV. I decide to give them a try since they were extremely busy & the food looked really good. 

At first the waitress seemed a bit rude after we sat down. It appeared our waitress was MIA, so another waitress to our order for our drinks. We decided to try the ham steak & eggs. We also got a waffle to share. The waitress brought out their homemade jelly. I choose the apple jalapeño & the peach jelly. They both tasted really good. Our ham steak was delicious.  Everything tasted so fresh!!! 

I will definitely, come again when I am in town. It turned out to be a nice experienced.   Our waitress turned out to be really nice... 

FYI: If your in town, this a good place to eat!!! Just keep in mind it's not the place you see advertised on tv. That place is Hash House A Go Go.

Soooooooo good and so fresh.. Love this place!  Great homemade food with a ton of healthy, YUMMO options on their menu.  Because everything is fresh to order do NOT expect to get in and out in a heart beat..

Just finished eating here.  We came here because of all the great reviews but also because we wanted to eat at Egg and I originally but the wait was too long. 

2 1/2 stars from us.

When we entered we saw the sign to seat ourselves which was good as the restaurant wasn't crowded.  It took a good 5 minutes before we good tired of waiting for someone to come and hand us our menus so my husband decided to get our own.  After 10 minutes of waiting someone came by yo ask us what we wanted to drink.  
After ordering our breakfast it took a good 20 minutes for our food to come out. 

What we ordered:

Raspberry cinnamon roll.  Very good.  Came our hot and had a nice chewy consistency.

Me:  Eggs Mary with grits and rye bread.  The food wasn't that hot considering it took so long to come out.  Rye bread was pretty good with their homemade jam but the jam wasn't that gourmet tasting.  Poached eggs were a bit rubbery.  Grits were a bit too thick and clumpy and luke warm.  Bacon was good though.

Son:  Eggs Mary.  They didn't bring out his sourdough toast but we couldn't be bothered to ask them for it.  

Husband: Party hash.  I told him that I really wanted to try the hash as everyone on Yelp was raving on about how good it was which is why he ordered this.  Even before trying it or didn't look like anything that spectacular.  My husband said it wasn't that good but I still had to try it.  It was so so.  Not crispy and a bit bland but a lot of filling.  Disappointed as I was looking forward to good hash.   You would think the food would be hot as it took so long to cone out but it wasn't.

When we asked our waitress for the check she forgot about it as I had to ask her again.  Took a while for someone to process our payment even though we paid at the register. 

My husband said the whole experience was very tiering.  I agree.  

Would we recommend this place to others or come back?  Probably not.  Large portions but not good quality.

Not only are the jellies good on toast, but I even put some on my Chicken hash after I ran out of Ketchup (To-Go). Only tried the Strawberry and Pineapple, but both were solid on the sourdough and full of flavor and pieces of the actual fruit. The Hash was tasty as well with shredded white meat chicken mixed in with onions, peppers and home fried potatoes. I should have gotten a different side, but I didn't know what kind of potatoes was orginally included, so I got double Home Fries basically. Will order fruit next time as the meal is pretty filling as it is and doesn't need two orders of potatoes. Eggs were cooked to my well done scrambled standards as well. Only $8 bucks, so a decent deal and if you dine-in you can try a bunch more of flavors of those jellies.
  Its also pretty comical also about how the tourists don't realize what they are doing and wander in here. Probably 20% of their business! Classic.

I was unsure about coming here, but my dad insisted we go, as he is a morning regular. This was honestly the best breakfast place I have ever been to. It was truly homemade, and had a comfortable ambiance. The staff was friendly and knew everyone by name. I cannot wait to return here!

Nothing special, wanted to go to "A GO GO" but mistakingly ended up here, there even was a sign on the place "saying it was recently filmed on some show", I wanted to try "Hash House A GO GO" because I saw it on Dives, Diners, etc... anywho, the place wasnt too bad but for what you get, it's is mediocre.. kinda on the expensive side. the only positive is they have a few different flavors of Ketchup and sauces which helps spice up the flavor.. other than that.. Dennys is more the theme

The service was pretty bad. The harried waitress repeatedly reminded us how busy they were. There were many empty tables but she was the only one working. She did come across as rude and impatient a few times however you could tell she was a nice person under stress. Clearly it was a management problem of understaffing. 
The food:
Strawberry waffles: very good. Fresh strawberries, which is a huge plus
Jam assortment: awesome! We loved the variety of jams. A must have if you visit
Blueberry pancakes: tasteless 
Veggie hash: just okay
Hash browns: a bit greasy, not very crispy
Home fries: mushy, not good
Interesting menus and great food. Service is excellent! Very clean, well organized place.

As a chef from being able to order the temperature of my eggs in the eggs Benedict, freshly ground Sumatra coffee every morning, 3 different types of hot sauces and ketchup made fresh, to home made chocolate cheesecake, pumpkin butter, watermelon jelly, jalapeño jelly, in Miami where i am from i have to pay fucking 28 dollars for a meal like this. Martha was the best server! So so happy we found this place.

What a great place. The food was fresh and delicious. It was the best hash I have ever had out. They have every hash combination possible. The staff is friendly and Mary comes out and checks to see everything is going well. The homemade jellies are a welcomed site. Great flavors. Would definitely come again.

Countryfied homestyle setting, this is definitely a place to make yourself a regular to.  The name speaks for itself, try it! As well as the scrambled eggs (crazy fluffy).  I would also like to point out the specialty jams and sauces which are brought to your table for your picking (taste bud ticklers), very nice! I  Hope that you agree 4 stars!

Went in around 10:30am on a Saturday morning and had no problem getting seating. Sat at the bar and interacted with several staff members, all of whom were super friendly. 

As the restaurant name suggests, they have a lot of hashes to choose from. I went with the salmon hash with a side of home fries and fruit. It was tasty but I think it could have been seasoned a little better. I eat a lot of 'clean' meals and so I crave good seasoning when I eat more traditionally. 

The hash didn't sit on my stomach really heavy like they typically do so I really appreciated that. They have a bunch of different jellies to try which was kinda cool. I was boring and went with grape vs. a fancier selection. 

I wasn't absolutely crazy about it but I'd go back and give something else a try.

Love love love this place. We come here everytime we visit Vegas. Fresh, hot and always yummy. Cinnamon Roll french toast is to die for. Highly recommend. Great homemade jams served with every breakfast.
Great chicken garlic hash.   Pooched eggs were perfect. Service was nice and. The restaurant was clean and very chill.  Little hole in the mall definitely going back.

Delicious!!!!!! Found it by chance and love trying local places. Worth the drive away from the strip. Great prices and good portions!!! Friendly staff and prompt service. Wonderful homemade jelly and bread. Yummy!!!

The overwhelming amount of options your search engine provides for "breakfast" can only be navigated by the star-labeled risk of others before you. And breakfast, coming from a restaurant defended by four stars, as simple and innocent as eggs with meat and potatoes can be, should be at least somewhat tolerable. 

This was mostly the opposite. 

In fact, bringing my mother-in-law here was nothing short of embarrassing. 

Biscuits and gravy for her, the lamb hash for me, and country friend steak for my fiancé. 

To begin, the service was horrible. An older woman with poofy grey hair, stone-faced and without consideration. She clearly did not have time to even consider listing the sides, and rather told me to just read them. Fair, as they were listed in the menu. So, we move forward.

A sigh as we order coffee and orange juice, an explanation of the hash browns that did not answer my mother-in-law' s question, and really just a general impatience. 

It takes 20 minutes for food, which does not bother us at all. This seems standard for good breakfast. 

But what comes out is disappointing. 

Lamb hash was bland. It tasted like dry, overcooked beef and potatoes. I would have never known that I'd ordered lamb, as the edges of each tiny bit were curling and on the verge of burnt. 

Biscuits and gravy were alright. Gravy was watery and without decent consistency or flavor. Comparable to packaged. 

Chicken fried steak was good. Moist, crispy, everything it should be. Topped with bland gravy. 

The fruit bowl was nice. Toast seemed refrigerated and ice cold. 

Jelly was awful. Ordered the most simple strawberry. Flavor was that of a jello packet maybe. Possibly worse.

This place probably gets mistaken for the Hash House A Go Go a lot.  However, when we called to make reservations, the person who answered the phone specifically asked us TWICE if we were sure we weren't looking for Hash House a Go Go. 

I ordered a Spanish omelet.  It was pretty good.  Had a little bit of butter flavor, which I generally don't like, but the overall flavor of the omelet was decent.  The olives and jalapenos in there were very good.  I shared the omelet and was still full.  It came with a choice of 2 sides; I went with cottage cheese and hash browns. The hash browns were standard; I enjoyed them.  I thought the portions were pretty good.  

The coffee was also decent.  It was good enough that I could drink it black.  There were also free refills on the coffee, which I certainly took advantage of.  

They had several homemade sauces that I thought were notable.  The habanero sauce had a good flavor, and was kind of sweet and interesting.  The chipotle had a usual smoky flavor (I like the habanero sauce better).  They also had a really interesting spicy ketchup, but by the time I tried it I had so many hot sauces that my mouth was on fire, and I couldn't really notice the spiciness of the ketchup.

My friends ordered the corned beef hash and enjoyed it.

This place also has an impressive variety of homemade jam, desserts, and dog treats for sale.  I didn't get a chance to try all of it, but I thought it was rather neat.

I really like the cozy, quirky, homemade mom and pop feel here.  The prices were like a Denny's ($7-$9 for an omelet), but the food was more unique. 

We came in a group of 10 people, and I thought service was reasonably fast, friendly, and they definitely kept the coffee coming.

I found my new favorite Breakfast place in Las Vegas. This place has the "soul" that is missing from another local jaunt The Egg & I chain. 

The owner, Mary, was right there cooking breakfast for the customers, making delicious feshly baked biscuits and phenomenal, unique hash style eggs. 

The server was very fast and helpful and the place is cosy and clean. When i went it was not busy but i cant  imagine how they deal when they're slammef. I highly recommend this place for breakfast and it looks like they have an awesome american lunch menu.
Great home style breakfast.  Nothing fancy.  I had chicken and waffles.  Husband had griddle cakes,  sausage,  biscuits and gravy.

What can I say about this place, it is amazing!!! I love just about everything about this place, food is amazing, good strong coffee, and after a couple of visits you get what I call " regular status" lol Which is a good thing. They take a little better care of you and maybe get to you a little quicker then say someone who's there on their first visit. I will say this ANY issues with service are more then made up for this the amazing home cooked food!!! Where to start, the hash is homemade and AMAZING!! The chicken fried steak is out of this world, crust is light and fluffy streak wasn't tough at all and the home fries with onions and peppers is sooo flavorful, and let's not forget the homemade jellies that's right I said HOMEMADE JELLYS after getting your food the server bring around a try of assorted jellies and ALL of them are amazing. I have been there now 4 times since I've moved here and will be there many more.

Been to Mary's many times. Started going to her restaurant when she was in Spring Mountain and then Decatur. Her food is always good, fresh and tasty. Had Monte Carlo sandwich today and it was good. Now I will be honest, no service is what you get. Asked for a glass of water never got it. No coffee refill, no checking to see if all is good. There is many breakfast choices in Las Vegas so Mary get your service corrected before you have no customers.

If your a visitor, this place is off the strip.... way, way off the strip. Have a rental, no problem? Need a taxi, it's gonna be pricey!  That being said, after driving out of our way to visit the place before it closed, I can honestly say "Whats the big deal"?  I really didnt find anything done exceptionally well.   I guess if you compare this place to (gasp) Dennys or even an IHOP, you may think its THE PLACE to go, but I just really didnt get it.  Maybe because it was the end of the day (arrived after 1pm) the staff was tired, the cook didnt give extra effort, or whatever reason it just was overpriced and bland.

The sausage patty breakfast is delicious. Watermelon jam was delicious. There's nothing "Vegas" about the place, in fact I felt like I was back in Effingham, Illinois. The service was perfect. If you think it takes too long to get your food you're probably used to eating out of a bag in your car.
Great food and the carrot cake was awesome! The omelettes were the best I've ever had. We cleaned our plates. Yum

This is a standard diner. The food's pretty pretty good and just what you would expect. 

The place it gets really special is the homemade jellies, the cinnamon buns, and Darlene, our waitress.

 The hash was pretty good, although the salmon hash has Brown sugar which is a little unexpected.  

 All in all, this is a solid breakfast joint
Highly recommended. Food was great, home made jelly was amazing and the server was nice! Definitely will come back

This place was awesome... I feel bad for not trying the Hash, but I've never had it and didn't feel adventuresome that day. Got a plain jane two egg breakfast that was great. What I did like, was the jam! They had a bunch of off the wall jams, not like the usual strawberry or grape, but Jalepeno (awesome, not spicy!) or watermelon! 
Service was great. Not overly pushy but fast and courteous. Never ran out of coffee and my cup was always warm. 
Next time I'm in Vegas, I'll try one of the different kinds of Hash breakfasts!

This place is located next to Aloha Kitchen in the Sahara/Decatur plaza. Minus 1 star bc it took a while for the server to take our order. She really was the only one there taking orders & cashing out customers.

Hash House (not to be confused with Hash House A Go Go) is simply incredible. This is my kind of place. I tried the chicken and waffles with grits and entered breakfast heaven. For added appeal, the large selection of homemade jams (I tried the watermelon) will keep me coming back for more.

I like corned beef hash, and breakfest in general, so I had to try this place out. On saturday's I like to eat a hearty meal after hitting the weights in the morning, and I go to Aloha Kitchen in the same plaza. I've seen this place before, but never tried it, but finally I did this past saturday.

I had the traditional corned beef hash, two eggs over easy, and you get two sides. I chose their country potatos and toast. Since I haven't been there before, I guess I made the right choice with their toast because their jelly/jams seem to be their main draw. They have a huge selection that they bring for you to choose from. I had apple butter, rasberry and peach. They were all good!

The corned beef hash looks different, redish and chopped into ultra small bits. I like mine to be a bit meatier, but this was both different and good. I'll try and post a picture of it so you can check it out. My current favorite for corned beef hash is Weiss Deli in Henderson...and it still remains tops.

I like this place and it seems to be family run. A few people came in and mistook it for Hash House A Go Go. It's also next to a Smoke Shop, and some even thought they could score some good hashish in here...they too were wrong (j/k!)
We went here on accident thinking it was the Hash House a Go Go but the food was pretty good anyways. We didn't order anything special, but the service was attentive and better than expected.

Not "a go go" I repeat, not "a go go." That would just be disrespectful to this little gem in the rough.

No, it's not fancy. No, their dishes don't match. And no, you won't have to take out a second mortgage to eat breakfast or lunch here. Good food is what I'm all about and this place hits the nail on the head. 

When in doubt, just go to Hash House (how many times do I have to tell you it's not a go go?). Sometimes you just need a little hash in your life. This place hashes like a professional hasher. Awesome flavor, great texture, and more importantly it feels like your getting a home cooked meal. Hash House is everything a chain restaurant isn't, which is why I like it so much. If you're looking for a basic breakfast they do that exceptionally well. Want something a little fancier like a Monty Cristo? Yep. They do that well. Personally, I'm more of a pancake and egg kind of fella. Mary, the owner, was featured for her pancakes on The Cooking Channel, so she has street cred. I can vouch for those tasty hot cakes, they're off the hook. 

Their homemade jams are superb. Generally 10+ choices and usually a few unique flavors. 

Hash House is definitely a "regulars" joint. Become one, you won't regret it.
