I fell in love with this place on my last visit to Vegas. The food was great servers were friendly and it had a great home type feeling. I love the fact that they make pretty much everything from scratch. And that includes their own blend of coffee and jam! If you want to scape Denny's and ihop this place is awesome. The only thing that can use some improvement is to get more staff. Wait for food and service is more than I'm use to.

We found this place on Yelp and gave it a try, I had the chicken hash which was dry and flavorless, like most white meat. I was hoping it would of had some seasoned dark meat in it. My wife had the ham hash which was more flavorful than mine. Their homemade sauces were good along with the jellies. My toast was burnt and placed upside down so I wouldn't notice it, the server was spread thin so we didn't get the attention we were expecting. When it started getting busy the owner Mary came out and helped tend to the customers.  If we come back I definitely wont order the chicken unless they start making it more moist. I'll probably try the ham instead.

Most wonderful cinnamon roll I've ever eaten. 
Great food 
A MUST for your breakfast.

I love LOVE this place.  My last visit I tried some new jams...jalapeno jam and pineapple jam.  I told Mary I liked spicy, so she brought me ghost chili jam and habanero jam for my toast...amazing!  I was able to purchase a jar of the jam and bring it home to enjoy...how cool is that!? I even received a few tips on how to cook with it. This place always feels like having Sunday breakfast with your family.  Thank you for always maintaining a high level of customer service and superior dishes.

Mary's Hash House was just okay. We were visiting from out of town and wanted to try something away from the strip. 

We ordered the Ham Hash, a fresh baked cinnamon roll and the Blueberry Oatmeal. Nothing to rave about. The best part was the jam & toast. Overall it wasn't horrible but I don't think I'd come back.
Love how the party hash is a little spicy and their sauces and jams are homemade! So amazing I can't wait to go back

Just amazing food! Mary's cooking skills are so great. Every kind of hash you want, homemade even. She even bakes amazing pastries.  Fried chicken and waffles are a must. AMAZING meatloaf. Better than grandma! Homemade jams, ketchup, and sauces. Very old school look. Want fancy, don't go to Mary's, but you want wonderful food, great service, and things homemade, Mary's is your place to go!!!!

Hands down, by far Mary's Hash House is the most original "Mom & Pop Shop" I've ever been to.

We were greeted by the owner Mary who had a big smile on her face while carrying out a fresh batch of Cinnamon Rolls.

I ordered their holiday special S'mores Coffee and blueberry Oatmeal-which was actually blueberry flavored Oatmeal!  Their menu had a huge selection of Hashes, homemade low carb bread, pumpkin french toast, stuffed meatloaf ect....OMG!

EVERYTHING is homemade-even their Jellies, which they bring out in 20+ different flavors on a sterling silver platter to you.

Seems that all the servers have worked here 10+ years, which doesn't surprise me since the feeling of family really resonates here.

Super excited to be a regular returning customer and happy I found a true home style meal in Vegas!

Mary's Hash House feels like you went over to grandma's house for breakfast.  Very homey.  The service from Martha today was very friendly and welcoming.  I think I have found my new favorite place for breakfast in Vegas. 

With a placed called HASH HOUSE I had to try one of their specialties.  Pastrami Hash was on the daily special board so that was an easy choice. However all the ingredient combos offered in the house of hash looked delicious. 

My food came out quickly from the kitchen.  A very generous portion of chopped pastrami with tricolor peppers, onions, home fries, hatch chilies topped with 3 eggs OE. It was a thing of beauty.  Very tasty hash indeed. The fresh wheat toast was also very good.  Martha came around to offer house made jellies to try. I tried the watermelon and jalapeño and both were excellent.  On your table they also have house made ketchups to top your dish with. My favorites were the Chipotle but the habenro had a nice kick. Next time I will ask for my potatos well done because I like the crunch. Everything is made to order so be patient when it's busy.

Another great find on Yelp!! I would have never know this place existed. I have eaten here twice and it has been consistently good. This is a real Hash House with several different kinds of hash!! Omelets, pancakes, waffles oh and did I almost forget the JELLY, they make about 20 different flavors and you can try as many as you want with your breakfast!! Would have been 5 stars but the biscuits and gravy could use a little work.

First time here, its a simple old school style place. 
You pick where to seat if tables are open to be seated, they dont have a lot of workers so the service its a bit slow but the busboy that we got was very nice and attentive to our needs. 
We wait for a good minute for the food but my goodness it was delicious!!! 
Very good food quality and quantity, it was worth the wait.

Without a doubt the best breakfast in Vegas. I've lived here for 3 years and have tried Just about every breakfast spot in town.  Mary's menu is original and pretty extensive but what I like the most is that everything is always cooked perfectly.  We found out about the place when we saw an episode of chopped on food network and Mary was a contestant.  Her chicken is the absolute best and I don't really like chicken but my wife ordered it one day and I tried it and now I order it almost every time.  Best Chili in town too. Everything is made from scratch.  She makes her own extensive selection of jelly and unique ketchup.  She even makes homemade doggy treats.  This is a must go to breakfast spot in Vegas

This is  one of my go-to spots, especially on Sundays. Most breakfast places have long waits, but Mary's always seems to be able fit me in with minimum wait; it's truly a hidden treasure. Any of the hashes are great; the potatoes are always crispy and the eggs are perfect. They always bring out a large platter of unique jams and jellies that are made in-house, so I'm always eager to come back and try something I haven't had yet. The decor is very traditional and feels like home. I love this place and see myself coming here for a long time. Totally worth stopping by if you're in the area.

From 4/26/16
The mother in law was in town that week and wanted to try one of the breakfast places we have out here, so we took her to Mary's Hash House. When you come in it's like an old school diner in the country which is awesome, I appreciate a place that has that sort of charm.

We sat down; our server was the type of lady you would find in a place like this; she had a dry sense of humor which can go either way depending on a person sensitivity level. Luckily, I speak dry wit, so I found her hilarious!

The menu is simple here, not a huge selection which I don't mind sometimes. I ordered the waffles with strawberries which I substituted the eggs for hash browns. The waffles were excellent, but the hash browns were pretty bland. They could use a little flower for sure. 

Other than that, I like this place and will return.

Man, despite the service deserving three stars or less (it's quite awful), I gotta hand it to this House for their awesome Hash. They've got homemade anything and everything. Loaves of bread, choco-chip cookies, coffee just the strength you like it, and jams and jellies you've certainly never tasted before.

Clearly this is beyond just hashing. Turkey hash, ham hash, roast beef hash, choices galore. Everything tastes just the way momma dreamed she could make it, if she lived on a farm.

I'd go again. It's different, tasty, and cheap!
Service was great and my breakfast even better. Loved the sangria and apple butter jelly. The iced tea was delicious too. I took 4 cookies to go and oh my yum! Definitely a new breakfast spot for me.

Horrendous. First time for both my friend and I. We had high hopes, had heard good things even from my non-yelp friends. Wasn't expecting a mid west style diner, when we walked in, the first thing I noticed was a giant big screen tv hanging over the bar replaying CNN or Fox (I can't even remember what it was, as I can't stand watching either) and a couple old dudes hanging around watching it. We seat ourselves, and we are roughly "greeted" by a woman and before I can finish my sentence of ordering coffee, she has already left our table. We noticed right away she was the only one serving the entire restaurant. So she comes back to finish our order, and before two words can get out of my mouth, she leaves to go answer the telephone. 

We finally place our order, San Diego Omelet with a side of grits and Monte Cristo with Sweet Potato fries. They both come out, they look decent, but one bite into the Monte Cristo and I was done, it was disgusting. Inedible and I don't know how but my fries were sour. I never leave a fry untouched. Never. I couldn't eat them. The San Diego Omelet was nothing special. The only thing this place has going for them is they don't use instant grits.

This place was such a sweet little surprise. Has a very mom & pop feel but there were a lot of little touches that made you want to come back. 

For one, Mary came around to ask us how everything was so that in itself was really impressive. 

Two, I ordered the corn beef hash and it was so flavorful and well portioned, just thinking about it is making me hungry again! 

Three, they came around with a tray of home made jams! To die for. 

Four, the atmosphere was really pleasant and the service was delightful. 

Definitely recommend, 5 stars.

This is quite possibly one of the best breakfast places I've ever been to. The atmosphere is nice and cozy and the food - amazing. I ordered the meat and eggs the first day I visited and was 100% satisfied. But, we came back the day after because it was all so amazing. That day I had their Eggs Benedict special and it was even better. I recommend this so much and to try all their unique jellies!

I like this place. Everything is homemade and fresh. You can pick you own hash meats. 

Even the jellies/jams are homemade and good.

Also: Anyone who mistakes this place for Hash House a Go Go is an idiot as that place is in Imperial Palace on the strip while this place is a little mom and pop Hash place in a little plaza corner.

Tired of the long lines and crowded brunches, we visited a local family breakfast place called Mary's Hash House. Their menu includes super tasty and vast omelettes, hashes, waffles and eggs but the real treat of this place is their homemade jam. 

Take a look at my blog post about my trip to Las Vegas and this delish breakfast place! 

http://lagamio.com/2014/04/24/las-vegas/

OMG! Where do I start? I've been going here for years, starting with their old location on Spring Mtn and now here at their new place on Decatur. I've a couple places I like to hit for breakfast, but Mary's Hash House is my favorite. It's not slick and fancy, there's no trendy music, nor do I have the choice of 20 different pancake flavors. What it does have is comfy casual good ol' home cooking, and that's usually what I'm in the mood for. 

I usually get The Skinny with a side of Super Hash. Darlene and the other server (sorry, can't remember your name!) always bring around a tray of home made jellies to choose from, which I love! Mary, the owner, is often busy in the back doing much of the cooking herself, yet still finds time to come out and ask patrons how they're doing. 

Now some people might complain that sometimes it takes a bit longer to get your food. I don't consider this a drawback because to me, this shows that most of the stuff is cooked to order and coming out fresh just for me. That's the way I like it and that's why I keep coming back.

Overall...super impressed!! Great GREAT food...everything is clearly fresh and did I mention the food is awesome?!

The party hash was delectable with the homemade Chipolte sauce. The waitress brought by about 10 different kinds of homemade jelly, so impressed with the quality!!

Great food,  large portions,  moderately priced. Amazing jams/ preserves.  

Someplace I will more than likely go back to.

I thought this place was okay. Service was pretty slow (at least for our table) and the food was mediocre. We ordered the Party Hash ($8.95) to share. It had corned beef, ham, roast beef, chicken, jalapenos, mushrooms, onions, and peppers served with 2 eggs, toast, and potatoes. It was good, but nothing I'd actually come back for. My boyfriend has actually been here before and he raved about the homemade jams they make. We saw the waitress go around to 2 other tables offering them jam from the tray she was holding for their, but she never came to us with it, so we had to go up to her and ask for some and she made the busboy bring some over to us. The selection was pretty awesome. They had apple butter, apple-jalapeno, habanero, strawberry, peach, watermelon, blueberry, raspberry, and grape. I went with the apple butter and Donald got watermelon. The apple butter was very tasty and the watermelon was interesting, but a little too sweet. I'd definitely come back here just to sample some of their other flavors.

Found this place this morning and had the BEST breakfast here. Homemade cinnamon rolls and an assortment of homemade jelly. Martha gave us such great service and obviously loves the food and working here. Fun. Loved it!!
Home town food with great homemade jelly.  If you like breakfast this is the place.  Small, but very relaxing place.

You walk in and you have to seat yourself , there is only one server and you don't get greeted till 10 minutes later .. I ordered my food at 11:10 and it's already 11:45 and still nothing . 
Stay home and make your own breakfast

Dear Hash House,

Yes I went to you by accident thinking you were that other hash house.. But I still ended up staying and not mentioning it or causing some awkward public scene. You probably knew I was looking for the other hash house and maybe that's why I got the cold service from you.

The waitress (owner?) seemed like a real nice down to earth lady with the other customers who were most likely regulars. But she gave us about 60 seconds worth of attention the whole time and we just quietly ate our food and left.

The food was simple, I had eggs, waffle, and a bacon. It wasn't all that flavorful, but edible and decent.

Sorry for making the mistake,

Ed

Seeking an alternative to one of our favorite hash houses, we came upon this little beauty.. This little mamas and pop's greasy spoon (which is all I look for today for the original foods and taste)... Great people, A-1 service, money saving and the food was to die for.... When in Vegas, this will always be my go to...

We try and eat at a different breakfast restaurant every Sunday. We found this place online and the menu sounded great, so we stopped by to try and we were extremely disappointed.  The service was very slow and not attentive. Also, the food took almost 45 minutes and was undercooked and bland.  We will definitely not be going back.

Been here many times over the years and overall give them 2-3 stars at best. Food is just okay and usually bland and not very hot. Biscuits are not toasted and gravy needed more meat and flavor.

Service is just okay overall but very bad when this one particular old lady is working. She is the reason for every 1 star review. Mary herself helped us once and boy that was special, great stories and just such a nice hard working lady but that is rare. Martha I believe with dark hair did good and was interactive and friendly, refilled and smiled etc. 

Refills come late or never on some occasions so glad they got big cups now.  

Getting a check is weird, I either get my bill before my food comes and when I wanted to add a cinnamon roll but I don't get my check for 15 minutes after finishing other days. I didn't get extra napkins a few times I needed them. 

This place is overrated for sure.

The food was pretty good, but the service was horrible. The older lady waiting tables was incredibly unfriendly, and appeared to be angry and miserable the entire time we were there. I requested some of their famous jelly after reading all the rave reviews.  She snapped back that she was just about to go to get it. Really? So sorry to have asked you to do your job. If you enjoy feeling unwelcome, this is the place to go. We will not be returning.

I really enjoy the regular corned beef hash and the party hash. I do have to admit that on some bites you take, there is too much seasoning, but that is easy to get over with. The real stars for me with the restaurant would have to be the rye toast and homemade jellies. They are excellent!

Hands down, and I mean that, hands down the best breakfast in town. I love the cozy, miss matched decor and friendly vibe. It feels like you are eating a home cooked meal at a friend's house. The food, particularly the corned beef hash and the monte cristo sandwich, are fantastic. Truth be told, I'm a regular. I've becoming here for roughly 10 years. The food has never suffered once and the prices have remained affordable. Mary, the owner, is usually around ensuring everyone is enjoying their meal. Which is something you just don't see too often anymore. Love this place.

I am amazed that after our first visit in 2015, when we first came to Las Vegas, and enjoyed a great breakfast, I have not returned until Father's Day. We wanted something close by, early in the am before the hordes arrived. Mary's is a quiet little secret, between Desert Inn and Sahara on Decatur. The staff are consistently well seasoned servers who know the products and who treat us like long lost family. I had the chicken and waffles which were so light and delicious. Coffee is served in a porcelain mug and is freshly roasted. My husband drools over the raspberry rolls in the case before even ordering his breakfast, and so we had the little container on our table right away, to take home.
My husband had the lamb hash, which could be more seasoned, but was good. Iced tea is freshly brewed, and it is not from a powder.
You will enjoy their home made jams too. 
I think that we will return often when a good, solid, tasty breakfast is required, holiday or not. They also have lunch meals til 2pm.
This is my favorite breakfast restaurant in Las Vegas. Home made jellies and sausage, fantastic biscuits and gravy. Mary the owner chef is the best!

Had the corned beef hash and it was perfect! Home potatoes were good. Their homemade jams are yummy!! I love jams! Tried the strawberry & peach. They have many choices. Met Mary and she was very nice and hospitable. This restaurant is located on the beaten path in a strip mall, very unassuming, don't judge the book by its cover, you will love your breakfast!

i ate hash house two days in a row this weekend.... i had to get my fix before i went back to l.a..... i give it 4 stars because my local friends that frequent the joint, dont like the service they receive from one of the ladies there, and ive only ordered one thing.... the party hash with fruit.... also the place is very plain in decor and took a while for the food... but  my friends say thats cuz everything is so "freshly made"...... 
if you like HASH, this is the best place to go because there were so many to choose from.... typically places just have corned beef hash, but this place has chicken hash, roast beef hash, and some others....  the food was good and not greasy like typical breakfast food, which i love........ also the fruit i ordered as a side was nice and fresh and not precut and old looking....
also, the HOMEMADE jam here for your bread is awesome!

It's been a little while since we last had breakfast here, and I am once again reminded of why we love Hash House so much. The fresh, delicious food and the friendly service. Everything here is made from scratch, and Mary, Darlene, and Martha welcome you by name, like family, even though they are always busy. 

This morning I tried the party hash for the first time, and it may be my new favorite. It's a mix of corned beef, roast beef, ham, and chicken hash with sautéed onions, mushrooms, peppers, and jalapeños, served with eggs and 2 sides. I do not enjoy super spicy food, so have been leery of the jalapeños in it. I needn't have been. They added just the right hint of spice. I also topped off the potatoes with homemade spicy ketchup and homemade chipotle sauce. Yum!

My husband had his usual: scrambled eggs with cheese, enormous homemade sausage patty, and 2 sides of grits with cheese. The sausage patty is hamburger-sized, and he loves it (even though he usually prefers links). I often waffle between one or another hash (corned beef, roast beef, lamb, super, duck, or lobster) and the waffle breakfast. I always enjoy whatever I choose, and Mary is always adding new items to the menu. I bring all my friends here, and they love it.

We stopped by on our way home to L. A. and we were so glad we did! The eatery is quaint, very clean and the waitresses are kind and helpful. 

We ordered the French toast stuffed with cream cheese and warm blueberry compote, bacon and spinach egg white omelette and the pulled pork hash with over hard eggs. Everything was delicious and well seasoned. 

We definitely make this our go-to place when we are in town!

Food is okay. Service is pretty terrible. Took the server about 10 minutes even take our order and then took about 30-40 minutes for our food to arrive. They only had two servers and two cooks with a full house. Water cup stayed empty the whole time and finally got the side of ranch that we asked for twice after 3/4 of the meal was already finished. The special spicy ketchup was pretty gross. It was really sweet and definitely not what my taste buds were expecting. The steak was overcooked. They have a variety of jams and jellies, which I thought was cool. That may have been the only thing I really liked about here. I would bump this place up to 4 stars if it wasn't for the really slow service. Perhaps I was just extra impatient that day considering I was hungover and needed food pronto.

I really wish I could give a lower star for this place. 
Let me just start off by saying I really tried to give it a shot because the owner was on Chopped, so I assumed it would be a hidden gem. Nope. 
Our server was rude, pushy and tried to rush us to order because she "had a 45 top that was coming in". Once we were ready to order she rushed through everything, spoke over us, so we kept having to repeat our order, and never have us her full attention.
I got the asparagus and Swiss omelette, mediocre at best. It was luke warm and she brought the wrong side dishes. ( White and Sourdough are two completely different styles of bread)
The biggest complaint I have however...the hash on my friends plate was the Salmon Hash, which would be fine but she ordered the Super Hash, and in fact hates Salmon.
So either they aren't cleaning their flat top or they served the wrong hash. Good thing she isn't allergic right? 
The staff is older, which I sometimes prefer, they have a way of making you feel at home. 
The entire time I was there I felt uneasy, in everyone's way and inconveniencing my waitress. 

The 'As seen on Chopped' sign on the window should be taken down if this is the general expectation here.

Wanting to try somewhere new, my friend and I decided to give this place a try.  He had heard good things about this place.

We met here at noon on a Saturday for breakfast.   I was STARVING!  I checked out the menu online and it looked good.

We sat down and got our drink order immediately.  About five minutes later we got our order taken.  I decided try their Superhash on recommendation of the bus boy.   For two sides that are included, I chose the hash browns and cottage cheese.  My friend ordered the superhash as well with hash browns and fruit.

THIRTY minutes later, we finally get our food.  What the heck?  Other people were seated after us and got their food in less than FIVE minutes.

The food was disappointing.  The serving size was very small and miserable and our food was COLD!  Why oh why me?  I felt robbed having to pay for the food.  We left afterwards in search of a decent meal.

I wanted to like this place based on other yelpers' reviews, but I have to disagree with them on this one.  Poor service and food.  I'd rather skip a meal than eat here again.
Great good great service. Everything home made. Best cinnamon rolls EVER. THANK YOU Mary & staff
The hash, homemade jellies, and cinnamon rolls were all top notch.  Great breakfast spot!

Hash House is probably my favorite breakfast spot in Las Vegas.   I know corned beef hash is an acquired taste but I love the stuff and this place does it best.  I also love all the homemade jams on thick whole wheat toast.   I've had the hotcakes several times as well and they are awesome!   This place is small and does get busy sometimes but have a little patience!  The owner is usually there is friendly and always checks up on my food.
I love this place!  The cook was on the show Chopped!  I always come here for my fix of meatloaf hash!  Great service and a great Vegas secret!

A hash house that specializes in hash. Who knew?! The hash is amazing here. They were offering a special duck hash and lobster hash the morning I went. I ordered the Classic hash. It was AMAZING. Next time I'll try something different, now that I know it's good. 

PROS: Classic Hash
            Cinnamon Bread French Toast
Had a GREAT breakfast. The food was delicious and the service was outstanding. I left there stuffed, the portions are great as well. I found my spot for breakfast.
The bombest food in vegas. The price is right and the people are so nice. Five stars fosho!

As far as breakfast joints go,this one is pretty tasty. They are tucked away in the southwest corner of Sahara/Decatur and it takes a keen eye to find them. Once you set your sights on the place, get ready to grub. The food is great and the portions are generous. It's a more laid back atmosphere and the service isn't speedy quick, so don't plan on a quick in and out. I got chicken fried steak and eggs with home fries and savored every bite. I was able to subsitute a pancake (she brought me two) for the toast. One of the best hotcakes I've had in Vegas. Not to be confused with the "a go-go", this place is unique unto itself, featuring homemade jellies. I was a little confused by the Christmas coffee mugs in September, though, and one of my co-workers was a little surprised when they cleaned the table and wiped it off right into his lap. Not quite sure what happened there, but it was good for a laugh and not bad enough to keep us from coming back.

Asked my cab dirver where can i get a good breakfast and he said the Hash house. I said ok. it was very good.massive size. the meat they brought was so big i could not finish it. If you need meat on your bones the first thing in the AM. HASH house if for you.

Visited November 2010

This looks like a small "mom and pop shop" that has a good feel but u Soon realize the lack of concern they have for their customers... No room to support a Sunday morning rush... Let's talk about the service... Let's just say the check came faster than the food did--literally waited for two hours. Also, who serves canned soda...? "Mom and Pop" capability but a "hole-in-the-wall" reality...

We were headed out of town leaving the strip and did not want to have another expensive breakfast. We found this place and it was amazing. Homemade jellies and jams and a very wide variety of breakfast items. The people were really nice. Definitely take the 10 minute drive away from the strip and check this place out!
Excellent traditional breakfast. Plenty of food for a 6'4" dude. Great friendly service

My husband and I are real breakfast people.  So we tried Mary's and the food was great.  Pouched eggs with biscuits/gravy and the party hash did not disappoint.  The fruit was fresh the coffee was strong and the jelly were jammin.  Our waitress at first seemed rough and unfriendly but once you started talking to her she was nice.  We talked about good food places to go for bbq because she from Texas.  Overall we will be back.
Monte cristo!!! Best I've ever had and great down to  earth service! Best jam as well! Loved it

Very underwhelmed with this place.  A pretty run down strip mall with decent parking.  Lots of empty tables at 10am on a Friday.  Our party of 8 was kind of overwhelming for the one server.  Service was lackadaisical but decent if not on the slow side.  They are known for their hash and most of us were pleased.  Great OJ but terrible fruit.  Not worth a long drive.  Decent if you are within a mile.
We sit at the bar and drink coffee and eat some good homemade hash. Never had a bad meal here. It is small so if they are busy then you will wait.great weekday place to grab a meal

Not to be confused with "Hash House A-Go-Go." The Hash House is that typical off the strip Vegas dilemma. The restaurant is an unsuspecting caught in the middle of a strip mall location. 
 The service is great, friendly and fast as I think the people who work there own it. The decor is almost random I guess this is some sort of Midwest motif? Even the plates don't match the cups and that's cool.
 The bottom line is the food is so good. As the name indicates it's all about their Hash. Before this visit I wasn't aware of how many varieties of hash there are. The Hash is the specialty and it's authentic. Not like the stuff I'm used to- from the can.  The Ingredients are super fresh and you get the sense that it's made from scratch per your order. This goes for everything from the coffee to the bacon as well. 
 Don't sleep on this place, because it closes at 2:00 PM... Get it don't sleep...Breakfast... Don't sleep, Um? Forget it... Hash House will be one of your favorite Breakfast spots.

Great coffee. All sorts of homemade jellies to choose from. Jalapeno, pear, pomegranate, Apple, jalapeno apple and many more that I lost track of.  

Martha was a wonderful server and more than accommodating for any substitutions for my order. Everything is made to order so you can customize your hash browns and add jalapenos or have no onions and they don't mind.

I ordered the country fried steak and it was excellent. Eggs cooked perfectly and the dill rye bread was a treat.

Wish I liked sweet things because their fresh cinnamon rolls smelled and looked amazing.  

Pleasantly surprised to find this place. Will definitely return next time I'm in Vegas.
Excellent food and service. Made from scratch,  taste the difference.  Mary amd Martha were fantastic.  Not too be missed

We love this place!!! We try to tell everyone about this restaurant. The hashes are each delicious, hearty and completely homemade. Mary, the owner, creates her own jams and jellies from scratch- a score of varieties like green apple-jalepeno, tomato, cherry, apple butter, even habanero! The eggs are always cooked to perfection. You gotta check this place out!

Located in a strip mall, the exterior is a bit dire, but once you get inside, that all fades away

Quirky, unique menu, huge portions, and super tasty. Had an omelette, and my dining partner had (what else) hash. Service was great and very fast. Server was accommodating without being overbearing. The homemade jellies were a nice surprise. Never would have thought jalapeno apple jam would be something I would eat, but it was very tasty.

Would absolutely visit again.

I would've given 5 stars, but my waitress lead me astray. First, let me start by saying that this will not be my typical, critical review but hey I am a critical person (that's why i Yelp for Help, lol). 

Anyhow, at first I was stuck between the choice of the salmon hash and the lobster and spinach omelet. I asked the waitress which one was better and she told me that she prefers the hash. Maybe, i shoulda went with my gut (especially because I was starving), but i heeded her advice and was severely disappointed. My salmon hash was chunks of salmon fillet spread over home fries. Maybe I was expecting something different but I was not too happy with the meal.

After notifying the waitress, i switched to the lobster and spinach omelet, which was like a party in my belly! It was delicious!!! I enjoyed my meal and would def return, but next time im not asking for advice!

I love this place .. The food was great and the waitresses were nice and met the owner . If you want a place where they will remember your name after only one visit,  this is the place . The jams are to die for . I will drive across town to get more jam . 

Yes you do seat yourself, however I like the choice and I love the small town feel to the place that reminds me of the small home town I grew up in . 

The food is great and the waffles and cinnamon buns are super yummy !!!

Who knows how to pack a punch ? Hash Hous- Ago-go does. 

Definitely gets a WOW factor when you bring out of towners here. 

The portions are ENORMOUS. We all thinking, more = bland. Not the case here at Hash House. It is delicious. 

My favorite dish is the biscuits and gravy. Does not disappointment any time at all. 

The serving size to price ratio is great. 

I often go for their lemonade with a watermelon slice garnish. 

Everything is good. Everything is worth the try. 

Service is usually pretty good here, but please mind that since they are so loved by the community... there may be wait between service. It's not outrageous, so bring good company, good read and you're set to start you're day just right!

I wanted to go to this spot since I saw the chef on Chopped lol. We ordered simple normal orders for breakfast such as omelettes and egg whites. The egg whites and turkey bacon were very good.

Our server was very good and very good at multitasking. She was all over the place while not forgetting about us. She gets love for referring a particular chipolte sauce they had and it was very very good. They offer a wide choice of their own home made jellies and jams-as well as other products which was cool.

I realize that the hash dishes were their specialty, which is why they get the love from me Holy Sweet Baby Jesus it was arguably the best hash browns I ever had seriusly WOW !!!.  I will definitely come back and try other things on the menu when I visit Vegas again. I strongly recommend on your first time visiting to try the hash browns it is a MUST !!!

Service was quick and attentive and all the choices look great! They make everything in house!including their own jelly! Who does that anymore! The coffee tastes great and is never empty. Definitely a thumbs up

The food is good (check previous reviews), but my most recent visit was very bizarre.  I had the same server as I have the past 10 or so times I've been in here, an older woman.  There was one other customer in the restaurant and Fox News was on the TV going on about the Trayvon Martin case.  

The server started talking to the customer about how casinos don't put up with people wearing hoodies, how there was a "weird Asian kid" who came in yesterday who wore a hoodie and baseball cap, and there's a reason so many black people are in jail.

Meanwhile I'm sitting like 10 feet away, wearing a hoodie and cap, and I'm half-black (very visibly not white).  What the hell?

I'll never be going back again, that's for sure.

Really loved the vibe at Mary's Hash House. The food is classic home-cooked diner from the Midwest or East Coast, and you will love it. But the location needs work to make it feel less "pop-up" store. Service was friendly and good, definitely worth giving it a try.

Just walked out of this restaurant after ordering could not bear to wait for our food. before we even ordered the server was running a vacuum through the restaurant loud as all can be.  We actually pulled up the health department rules on our phone to show the server and she seemed very uninterested her biggest concern was the fact that they were closing and 40 minutes as she rushed around through the restaurant attention of her presents was also on bearable. There were about 5 tables in there eating listening to the vacuum cleaner girl as we watched her vacuum right up against tables where people were actually eating at.  

You can see the cooks working through the window from the dining room and we watched one of the cooks picking up utensils while making food and a bottle full of mail anyway he had absolutely no gloves I'm neither did the other cook we could see through the window in the back kitchen.  Just seeing a cook preparing food without clothes on health code violation number to then when our server went to get the coffee the sanitizer f*** it was leaning up against the coffee pot switch also was another violation and we said the heck with this place we're out of here as we were leaving one of the servers asked why we told her and all she did was turn around and go in the back kitchen eat at your own risk.
The food was delicious! They have great customer service and the homemade jelly is really good. This place will forever be on my list of places to eat when I visit Las Vegas!
Take a bow Mary!!! Amazing food with a down home feel. Best Monte Cristo I have had in years!! Get the jellies to sample!!

I had no idea what hash was, and honestly still don't. We were out sight seeing and came across this place. Very homey type feel, nice and laid back. I ordered the waffles, cheese eggs, bacon, toast, and side of grits (I know I'm such a foodie). DELICIOUS! Are waitress was lovely, and brought out our food ni e and hot. Mary the Chef/Owner even came out to sit and laugh with us for a bit. Make sure you meet her when you go, she actually kinda funny.
Mary's home made pumpkin pie and peach pie are exceptional. The best We've had.
Average French toast and good eggs and turkey bacon

This was a first time visit only because the line at The Egg and I was more than I could bear.

A small, quaint, and well decorated place.  Seated ourselves and a normal wait before someone brought menues and took our orders.

I'm a coffee snob so wasn't going to order the coffee but asked about what they offered.  Farmer Brothers was their "house" coffee but they also offerred a Colorado River Roasting Company (Boulder City) fresh roated coffee, so I had that.  I recommend it to my fellow snobs. Be careful during refills because wait staff have no clue as to the difference and will pour you the Farmer Brothers.

I had biscuits and gravy and I was very disappointed.  My daughter had the corned beef hash and it was hortible.  My sons order had a grey hair in it.

Man!....Best thing to do here is to look at what everyone else is eating and to make sure your plate is the exact opposite....The food portions are huge, food looks amazing but if your concerned about caloric intake and keeping your belly within your belt line...This isn't the place!...My wife and did tear down their monstrous ass pancake!!!!...If you don't care about what you eat...have at it!...Although i might get those chicken and waffles next time!

Awesome food. Raspberry roll was delicious to start with. Mary's hash with biscuits was outstanding with bacon gravy is delicious hashbrowns are perfect the the house jellies are delightful. Martha our waitress was super
Spot on diner food. A bit of a redneck vibe first thing in the morning but quality coffee and breakfast.

Nice little find. Came to watch a friend get a tattoo next door and was hungry. Loved the home fries. Really good thick cut perfectly cooked crispy bacon. Service A+. Will come back again if we're in the area.

This was my second time in to what's quickly becoming my favorite breakfast spot in town. Several hash options are available (hence the name) but I went with the veggie hash from the "secret menu" per yelp recommendation. Asparagus/mushrooms/onions/peppers/potatoes possibly zucchini too (cant remember) all under two eggs any style (I went over-easy) with a side of toast. Topped it off with house made chipotle & habanero sauces for a subtle flavor boost that worked well with breakfast. Oh, and definitely get the homemade dill rye if you're a fan of rye bread. I chose the apple jalapeno jam and it was a surprisingly delicious combo. In-house (notice a trend here?) cinnamon rolls and carrot cakes are also available. Coffee is good, they have several creamer options (caramel/vanilla/Irish creme), and the prices are very reasonable. Martha, our waitress, made sure we were never wanted for anything. Great job! Tasty food and good service, what more can you ask for?

We  eat here all the time but Ol Mary had a understaffed situation on Monday December 28th.
45 minutes to get Cold food 45$ down the drain. We will be taking a break from this place for a while.

When Friend #1 said he usually goes to Denny's for breakfast when he's in Vegas, I knew I had to lead us all into the light!

Parking was easy and free in the strip mall lot, and we seated ourselves when we walked in.  We were greeted with menus by our friendly server and coffee (regular or bold!), decaf and waters came out fast. 

Our food landed in front of us within 10 minutes of ordering - yay!

Me: Angus Top Sirloin & Eggs ($10.95) - served with cottage cheese and an english muffin (my choice of 2 sides), my steak was perfectly rare next to the scrambled eggs.  This is what I needed!

Friend #1: Corned Beef Hash ($7.95) - served w/hash browns and an english muffin, this potatoey, oniony hash had crispy bits of meat in it.  It was not as meaty as we expected - they could stand to bump up the ratio of meat to potatoes & onions.

Biscuits & Gravy ($7.25) - served w/2 eggs and nicely crisped bacon, these b&gs were yummy!  Still crispy edged yet fluffy under the gravy.

To share: Blueberry Pancakes, short stack ($3.50) - super blueberry-y, not overly sweet, really good!

After the food came out, our efficient server brought a tray of house made jams and jellies for us.  They sparkled like multi-colored gems!

We tried:

Apple Butter - super cinnamony, we all wanted to eat this with a spoon

Pineapple Jam - sticky and chunky, like pie filling, this was tasty but overly sweet.

We loved the casual diner atmosphere, and the food and service made us happy. So yes I'm a fan!

If you're going for the hash
or omelettes than it's pretty tasty! We went around lunch hour and ordered breakfast. It wasn't busy at all.   My fiance had the Party Hash and it was tasty. The home fries were good and well incorporated with little bits of  onion and green peppers. 
The  jalapeno  seasoning on the table was delicious over the hash . The waffle plate was sub-par. It felt like it was previously frozen or it was made from earlier and he just reheated it. It was soft, salty and not crispy at all. 
The jam shots are bomb!  The service was sweet and quick.

GREAT breakfast at Mary's Hash House...delicious and interesting variety of hash...homemade jams and jellies...quick and courteous service, great coffee...if you're off the strip and looking for the mom-and-pop experience, try this place...

This place is AWFUL!!!  If you're looking for a good/great breakfast, go to Mr. Mamas or Babystacks.

We went on the recommendation of a local hairstylist.

There is only ONE waitress working the entire restaurant  (never seen that before) and her customer service is terrible.  The only good thing that came out of here is the toast and jam.

Save your appetite and money to be used at a better place to eat.

You have been warned.

Ok, so this is not blah blah a go go..... this place is about food, not fancy presentation nor fantastic service but your basic "diner' type service w/ great food.

I had the house hash (of course) or hash house?  This was some good hash, peppers n onions diced up, hash browns, eggs over medium and toast. Add ketchup and Tabasco, then walla.... a masterpiece...

They have a daily selection of jams, I tried the Jalepeno (spicy n sweet, very interesting...) and the strawberry (yummy, like fresh strawberries)

If you want no nonsense, good breakfast, then this is it!

I plan on trying blah blah a go go next, just to experience the whole a go go thing...... but not to compare....til next time, good eating a go go!

Mary's HASH HOUSE not to be confused with the hash house a go go, is an awesome breakfast spot! Chicken and waffles were spot on. I got 1/2 the chicken, perfect amount of seasoning, crisp skin, and juicy meat! If that wasn't enough it came with home made grits and 2 eggs.  The portions didn't even fit on one plate! Service was very attentive and personal as well! 

If you like going to a breakfast spot that doesn't have overblown Vegas Strip pricing and hungover party people then you should definitely give this place a go.
The best.  And the coolest part is that Mary is always there and so so sweet!  Love these independently owned and operated gems.  Especially in a place like Las Vegas!  We love Mary's Hash House!

Though I have not sat inside to eat I have ordered take out a few times and everything I've tried has been boss. The only reason I gave 4 stars was because I so see room for improvement. I'd suggest maybe adding some seasoning to the fries. Maybe some salt/pepper or maybe some good old seasoning salt. Anyway keep up the awesome food making!

They were featured on the food network and were voted one of the best places to have breakfast in Las Vegas by Rachael Ray.
My wife and I had one the best meals in a long time. Everything is homemade including the jellies. We will be back to have their lunch specials

THIS IS NOT HASH HOUSE A GO-GO! it is BETTER! #1 reason, no wait no big crowds, we were in & out of there in about 30 mins for our party of 2, we wanted somewhere fast but not fast food because we had an appmt soon. But it's also a small mom & pop place where you can bring the kids and have a nice family Sunday brunch. Can't wait to go back and try their famous home made jams/jellys and their party hash everyone raves about. Oh and they also mix their own ketchup, chipotle or habanero flavored, perfect for the ketchup+Tabasco combo lover like me!

Try their apple butter jam. Homemade and very delicious!

Very affordable and hearty portions. Delicious food. Away from the busy strip. If you have a car this is def the place to have breakfast at.

This place is great. It feel very homey. I bring my friends from out of town and they love this place. The food is delicious and the prices are reasonable. When you can, try the carrot cake, so yummy!
Confort food at its best! My wife introduced me to this delightful place. One of those hidden gems I hope stays open for a very long time. The breakfast sausage patties are so good!!!!

I've been coming here for years and always have a great experience.  The food is clean not greasy and Mary the Chef and owner creates special dishes and takes diner/breakfast food to the five star level workout all the smoke and mirrors of the high end places.   The place is clean and homey and the staff who's been there for years are fast and friendly.  I took my son here today and he ordered the chicken hash..... I can't believe he ate the whole thing!

I really don't write reviews here, but I have to let my voice be heard on how rude I was treated by "Mary".  
Myself and 2 other co-workers ordered some food here.  He ordered a sandwich with fries, the other the San Diego omelette with hash, and myself tuna melt with fries.  When he got back we were all surprised to see that we all didn't get sides!!!! Not one of us.  Now I understand that if it said sides are extra on the menu but no it says "comes with your choice or sides!!! And to make it even more "wtf" my sandwich and my buddies omelette are in one box!!!!! Really "Mary"?!?!
So I called and "Mary" answered it ( the reason I put quotations on this is because she said she was Mary the owner but you never know). So I told her that we didn't get any sides.  She replied that's how we ordered it......yes Mary all 3 of us decided we all don't want sides so that we can keep our figures.....OH NO!!! We are hungry boys working morning till night!!! I told her no we ordered 2 fries and one hash.  Her response was, "no you didn't". I also told her that even both my main order and my buddies main order were in the same box. Her response, "that's how you wanted it". Yes of course Mary we wanted our food together so that we can recreate the scene from Lady and the Tramp!!! 
So then she just cut me short and ask, "so what do you want"......Excuse me?!?! I told her well cutting your attitude to a customer would be nice.  To which she replied again, "that's how you wanted it, so what do you want?"  After that I asked her for her name and she said, "Mary, the owner.  Well Mary the owner.  Thank you for no sides even though you gave us a bottle of ketchup!!!! And thank your for your gracious attitude Mary! You remind me of the character "Mom" from Futurama.  Look it up Mary.....I will definitely not come here anymore. And will let everyone know about your attitude.  Like I said I don't do reviews unless it's super awesome service, or someone treated me bad.  You fell on that Mary.  Best of luck to you and your business....(also check out my pics on here on how our food was presented along with their menu)

We came here on a recommendation 2 days ago for breakfast. Had meatloaf hash. Yum. They also had house made jellies in several flavors, we chose apple jalapeno. I would just eat the jelly and skipped the toast! Service a little bit slow but not bad. Prices about the same as other places we normally go. Would come here again.
Literally the best cinnamon roll I've ever eaten. The service was great and the food was amazing. I'm coming back every time I visit Las Vegas!

FAVORITE: Corned Beef Hash w/ over medium eggs w/ hasbrowns slathered w/ HABANERO KETCHUP 

ok so i dont want to look like a pig so this is usually breakfast and tomorrows lunch or something, but this place is amazing...

our friend introduced us to this place a while back and we have craved ever since, we always try to make it a point to stop here whenever we are in town. My boyfriend and i LOVE IT!!! 

the habanero ketchup is to die for it gives everything that great kick and the corned beef has isn't like any other. I went to original pancake house and got the corned beef has there but it was served like in a patty?!? 

this place is a cute family owned place and their service isn't bad for one waitress and one busboy. They are relatively attentive considering both times i've been there hasn't been a wait. 

okay so this review may be all over the place, but i just can't express how great i think this place is!!!!
Always so dang yummy! And Mary is so personable with her guests!

If you are looking for some CBH, this is the spot!

Right down the street from the HHAGG, this hidden gem is tucked away in a strip mall at Decatur and Sahara.

This place is a small slice of Americana and the owner, Mary (featured on FoodNetwork's Chopped) is awesome! 

A must try if you have the chance for multiple trips is the Party Hash. Also, check out the homemade jams.

Be warned that the food doesn't always come out as quick as some people would like it, but it is well worth it.
Outstanding, great breakfast a selection of jellies and jams like you've never had before.
First timer to Mary's Hash House. Her homemade hash terrific, hand made preserves and jams awesome and service great. Her hand made cinnamon rolls to die for. Skip the strip and eat there!

If you're in Vegas visiting from Manitoba or Michigan, this probably isn't the Hash House you're looking for.  Hash House a Go Go is another 2 miles up on Sahara, turn right when you start getting the smell of wasted food and rosemary branches from the ridiculously large servings they shovel at you there.

With that out of the way, this place is great.  I'm here almost every Sunday for breakfast.  This is the kind of place I would want to hang out if I lived in a small town.  It's almost out of place in the strip mall, and would seem a lot more at home on Main Street in some city famous for the world's largest collection of rubber bands, or the track team winning the class AA title for the last 4 years running.

None of the glasses, coffee mugs, forks, knives, plates...anything matches.  You can tell it's all a mishmash group of utensils and china that has been picked up when prices are good.  I think it's great.

The food is outstanding.  It's hard to decide many Sundays what the best thing to get is.  I usually stick with the Party Hash, which is a mix of the Corned Beef/Turkey/Roast Beef/something else Hash.  It's by far the best hash I've ever had.  I've been eating it on a regular basis for six years.  When I'm up for something different, the triple decker sandwiches never disappoint.  

I won't go line by line of the menu, I'll just say.  I've been coming here forever and have never left disappointed.

Two of my favorites that would suggest to all first timers.

#1: The Sausage Patty.  The Homemade sausage is perfect.  For people like myself that don't enjoy sweets and would much rather follow up a steak dinner with another steak than a piece of chocolate cake, this is as close to heaven as you get.  Even if you just like sausage a little bit, get the sausage.

#2: Homemade Jelly.  She always does something special, but my favorite has been the Sangria Jelly.  At the same time she did Sangria there was a Tequila Sunrise Jelly as well.  Both were awesome, both will be missed.  The basics are always awesome as well, Strawberry is my go to jelly.  I would probably inject it into my vein, given the chance.  Get toast, just to try the jelly.

Short story:  This place is great.  The service is what I would expect out of a diner-like establishment.  Sometimes is gets a little busy with theafter church/baseball tournament crowd.  However, Darlene is always great, and always fun to talk to.  Same with Mary, the owner, always friendly and available to help.

If you're hungry for great breakfast and have an extra $10/head make the trip to the corner of Sahara and Decatur.  You'll be glad you did.

We just went back for our second visit. The hash dishes are really good. The Party Hash consists of too many ingredients to remember, and is very flavorful. Our server was very friendly on both ocassions. The only thing keeping us from giving 5 stars is that we were overlooked both times when we first were seated. You seat yourself, and can be ignored (there are two rooms, and it is difficult to see us where we chose to sit). We will definitely be returning for the breakfast!

I love this place. The food is great and the environment is homey. Really enjoy their home made jams. The only complaint I have is that the older waitress that works here isn't very polite. I've come here 4-5 times within 3 weeks and got the same service from her each time. Walks up to the table and doesn't even introduce herself. Still don't know her name, Even on slow Mornings i Get the same amount of attentiveness as a busy day from her. The other waitresses are on top of their game.

This is by far the best breakfast place you can go to in Vegas. It's a locals place most people don't know about definitely a amazing find!! Been going here for about 2-3 years now. The owner marry was on the food network show chopped and won. Food is so good she makes her own jam fresh daily. If you haven't been here go try it out you will not be disappointed. (The breakfast hash is amazing)

This is hands down the best breakfast place I've ever visited! Mary's Hash House has the most delicious corned beef hash on Earth. I've been to Hash House A Go Go and there is no comparison. Mary's food, service, and hospitality far outranks them. 
This place is cute, comfortable, and cozy. The jam selection is outrageous and tasty! If I lived closer I'd come all the time. 
Perfect start to Easter Sunday...they even give you colored Easter eggs! 
I highly recommend Mary's to anyone who is visiting Las Vegas

Adding to this review was totally needed because over the course of two trips, I've come here three times! I can't get enough of Mary's corned beef hash, delicious and fresh, it's still the best I've ever eaten.
I wish she'd open a place in the Bay Area...are you reading this, Mary?

I wasn't sure what to expect when I walked in but if it's been around for 20 something years? or so I thought to myself it has it has to be good? It was a Sunday morning and there a bunch of open tables. We were told to pick a table so we did. After that it took a good 20 minutes before the lady came back to get our order and I was a bit annoyed because other tables who came in after us was getting their order taken. However, they had a different server so I'm not sure why our server was slow. 

We ordered and the kids menu is very minimal. I ordered the original corned beef and hash with over medium eggs. My eggs came out sunny side up and runny all over the place. My corned beef hash was like burnt hash browns. The flavor was lacking and it was just overly crispy except for my eggs. On the plus side she asked if I wanted all of the peppers and onions and she was able to omit those. 

Overall I did not enjoy the food at all. Cool that they have homemade jelly but it didn't balance out that I had burnt food. Service was mediocre at best but it is what it is. I definitely would not come back when there are so many other breakfast places that are awesome.

Wow! This place rocks! The service, the food, the wonderful home made deserts and jams. I've never been here and I live in San Diego. I'll come here any time I'm in town. The owner was beyond sweet and gave my buddy and I great big to go cups of coffee which was another wow! I've been running F&B almost 20 years and she's doing a excellent job. Keep "Mom and Pop" alive and we will see you very soon. Thanks again.

Oh. My. Goodness. 

This is one of the most wonderful breakfast experiences I have EVER had. And I love food!

Mary's does not disappoint in the diversity of menu, savory homemade dishes, and home style feel. 

Ms. Martha completely rocked the entire restaurant as the only server and dazzled us with the wide assortment of seasonal, housemate jams. The apple jalapeño, pumpkin butter, plum, raspberry, and strawberry jams were all excellent. How blessed am I to have been with a group for a wonderful sampling?!?

And the apple butter.  What! Not an accurate description- more like Apple Pie Preserves. So good I bought a jar to fly back to Michigan with me. 

I had the salmon hash, others rounded the table off with meatloaf hash, party hash and the tri tip hash. Even the traditional bacon and eggs breakfast looked amazing! 

I carried out a large slab of Mary's carrot cake to eat on later. 

Every future trip to Vegas will have at least one stop to this gem!

Food is really good! Yes the service is not so great and the kitchen is slow, but the prices good and I really enjoyed the ham hash especially with added jalapeño! I would  definitely go again. And they had there own jams, which are really good too!
