Do you know a place where you can get a home-made hash, served with a home-made spicy ketchup or a home-made habanero sauce, or a home-made chipotle sauce; served with toast, served with a choice of at least 20 home-made jams, with flavors like watermelon, habanero, apple, strawberry, jalapeno, peach?

Well, now you do - it's Hash House (not to ever be confused with the Hash House A-Go-Go chain) To see it is to believe it - so check out the photos link above.

'nuff said. 

Must haves:

Super Hash
Monte Cristo 
Meatloaf 
Stuffed french toast (4 pieces) with cream cheese and topped with fresh made berry compote.

Our first time here. Went on a Monday around 10:30am. Only 3 other tables occupied and had a little bit of a wait until our server cane over to take our order. The main entree was ok (Mary's hash). The best things I enjoyed were the side biscuit and cinnamon rolls. Those two items would be the only reason why I would go back.

I love this place. I would go all the time and now that I don't live in Las Vegas anymore, I make sure I stop by for breakfast when I make it back to town. 
The staff is great and very friendly. Food is great. What else can you ask for? Oh yeah, they also have strong coffee. 

Amazing

It was my first time to try this fabulous restaurant. My cousin and I were deciding if it was open since it is a hidden gem!! The turkey hash was excellent! The homemade jellies were amazing! Especially the watermelon and jalapeno! My lovely cousin who is a Las Vegas resident bought me 2jars to take back to Hawaii. MARY the owner is so friendly she gave me a hug!! What a gracious lady!!!
Terrible service. The place was 3/4 empty and it took 45 minutes to get our food. These guys are banking on their tv exposure.

Just visited this place for the first time from out of state based on Yelp feedback.  It is in a nice area and restaurant is clean and appealing.    Food was reasonable and tastey.  I had traditional corned beef hash and it was very good.  My son had turkey hash and it was dry.

You have to get cinnamon rolls or raspberry ones if they are hot and fresh.

Reason I didn't give 5 stars was service was horribly slow,  waitress never brought my daughters hash browns,  waitress was personable nor suggestive. 

To get 5 stars it has to be complete package.

BAD BAD BAD!

Came here for breakfast on a Friday morning with my family.  Walked in and the place was busy.  

"Seat yourself" sign was up so that is what we did.  The counter was full of people watching the tv, the front room was busy and since we had a party of 7, we had no choice but to go to the adjacent room.  DISGUSTING...we walked into the room and noticed a man sitting at a table and no one else; and that could be because all the tables in that room were dirty except for two tables that we managed to move together to accommodate our party of 7.

I looked at the clock and it was 9:50 when we sat down.  My son asked if he could stand by the doorway to watch tv, so I let him.  10:10, no one has come to our table to take our order.  However, the one server did manage to yell at my child when she came into the room to delivery the food to the one man that was sitting at the table next to us.  Again, she walked out of the room without acknowledging us...taking our order or apologizing to my child.

So this restaurant has been here for 20 years?  Really???  Then maybe in those 20 years the owners of this restaurant would have learned that you NEED more than one server and perhaps hire someone to clean the tables as customers leave.  

You do know that is a health violation right????  

Your food might be "Good" but please, its not that good to where people are going to put up with the bullshit attitude of your server and the disgusting conditions of your restaurant.

The only reason this even has one star from me is because I can't give zero! Absolutely horrible service! Our waitress brought us our food and never once checked on us. The lobster hash was violently flavorless and one of the most disgusting meals I've ever had. I could only tolerate a few bites. My husband and I eat out A LOT and we will never eat here again and we tell everyone we know to avoid this place at all costs.

This restaurant is a hidden gem. The food is homemade and simply delicious, nothing pretentious about it. The jams were so comforting and delicious. The staff despite the restaurant being busy, was friendly and attentive. This restaurant now ranks in my top 3 breakfast spots.

The hash was delicious, my bacon and cheese omelets was yummy which I personalized by adding the country gravy on top. Server was a nice older lady but her priorities were definitely on the customers that appeared to be regulars. She brought out a tray full of a variety of homemade jams. We tried the strawberry, cherry and apple butter. YUM! They had 2 flavors of coffee regular and bold, and also offered flavored creamer!! They had vanilla, hazelnut and half and half creamers in the bowl she brought. On our way out I saw the display of the different jams for sale and without question i bought the apple butter. Came in a small mason jar maybe 8 ounces for $8, pretty expensive and I never spend that much on jams so you know it was good :) Apparently the owner Mary was on the tv show chopped the night before which I was unaware about. very cool though, will definitely be back and become a regular with the extra treatment haha

Small & Cozy Midwestern Diner feel, SEAT YOURSELF. CLEAN-NOBoothes-All tables


Have a TV & Counter bar too
Very friendly & attentive. MID-Western FOLK!! Felt like eating in MOM's kitchen
Hearty portions, Lots of variety on the MENU, Fresh fruits, over 30 flavors of HOMEMADE Jam,Fresh breads and THE BEST HASH!! You could order Toast & JAM & have a GREAT meal & GeT FULL!!


Homemade JAMS toGO!!!!
Top BREAKFAST Spot!!! Great FOOD , Atmosphere & service .If you are looking for some place you can eat EVERY day & have something NEW & delicious THIS IS IT!! VERY REASONABLY PRICED TOO!! Most everything us under $10!!!

I was surprised to find out this great breakfast and lunch restaurant has been open since 1994.  I'm a new fan of Mary's party hash and the cinnamon roll is out of this world.  If you are in Las Vegas and looking to get the best breakfast in town - it's worth taking a drive off the strip or from anywhere in the city.  You will not be disappointed .  Love the Midwest vibe and cooking .  Staff is very friendly and make sure you say hi to Mary - she is fantastic!

Had a great breakfast late on a Monday morning, mostly locals in there, good attentive servers, the jams and jellies were great, I had the meatloaf hash. My sister-in-law could have used some home-made salsa, but they don't have that, and other than that, we all enjoyed our late breakfast and coffees.
Extremely good service was amazing as well had the party hash with homemade spicy ketchup..... Perfect

Based on an all around review (not just the food), I only gave this amazing place 4 stars. 

I'll start with the "not so awesome". The cleanliness of the dining area could be better and the bathroom wasn't that pleasant but the part that got me the most is the seating. It can be a little cramped. 

THE FOOD!! I will definitely go to this spot many times for the food. Everything I tried (three dishes) was wonderful. 

The main dishe I had was the Argentina eggs Benedict with mariscos (shrimp). The spices they use with the hollandaise sauce goes perfect with the poached eggs and shrimp. I will definitely get that again. 

It is a little off the strip but worth the drive. If you are in the Las Vegas area, I highly recommend this place.

Oh, Mary, how I wanted to love your Hash House.

My husband is a bit of a hash connoisseur, so I was super excited to accidentally stumble upon Mary's Hash House. All kinds of hash AND fresh cinnamon rolls drowning in icing?? This was going to be his new favorite place!

We arrived at 10am. The sign said As Seen On Chopped & it was busy. All good signs.

You seat yourself. Mary's house house is pretty small and not fancy, but who cares as long as she's killing it in the food department, right?!?! It took a while to get menus because it seemed like there was 1 server for the entire place. Then it took a while to get our drinks. Then it took a while to get our orders taken...you see where this is going. Service is SLOW.

We ordered the Roasted Chicken Hash w/ Hash Browns, the Corned Beef Hash w/ Home Fries, & of course a cinnamon roll.

They were out of cinnamon rolls.

Our Hashes arrived. They come w/ 2 eggs and toast. They bring home made jams by on a tray for the toast. We tried the raspberry & the apple butter. My husband loved the raspberry. He later said it was the highlight of his meal. The apple butter was heavy on cinnamon. Honestly, it was pretty chunky to be called a butter or a jam.

So, this hash. My corned beef hash was OK. Flavorful & greasy. Definitely not spectacular,a bit too salty, but still good. The Roasted Chicken was awful. There is no way this chicken was roasted. Boiled maybe, but not roasted. And, it was absolutely flat & flavorless. No salt. Definitely no garlic (the menu said garlic).

The 1 server was way too busy to check on us, so there was no sending anything back or complaining. We left the eggs behind which were kinda rubbery and took the hashes home. I figured I could doctor them for lunch.

Sadly, the food missed the mark, too. If in fact Mary's was on chopped, based on this experience they didn't win.

Here again at Mary's.  I don't remember if I commented on their coffee previously but it is sooooooo good. I had the fully caffeinated version with caramel macchiato creamers and it was divine.  The waitress informed me that they use a Brazilian Sumatra coffee that is ground fresh before brewing.  Better than Starbucks baby!

I LOVE this place!!!
I am soooo impressed with the quality of food!
So fresh, the turkey hash was delicious!
Eggs were good, toast good, hash browns good, and the combination of all of that on the plate with the Smokin' Habanero Sauce made it AMAZING!!!!

So my friend wanted to come to this place because it the chef was on Food Networks' Chopped.  Sure, breakfast.  What can go wrong?

This is clearly a locals place, but I have to wonder, has this place gone downhill since being on tv?

We went on a Saturday, a bit after the brunch rush, it wasn't even lunch time yet.  They were not busy, and it was "seat yourself"

A server came pretty quickly to take our order, but man did we wait FOREVER for our food.

It was 30 minutes (no exaggeration, I timed it) after she took our order, and we were STILL waiting for our food.  We looked around, first off they were NOT busy, the place was not full, but there were people that were already seated before us that were also still waiting for their food.  We also never saw our server again.  No one came to check in on us, no one came to check on drinks, or to tell us sorry it's taking so long, but the food is on it's way.

We didn't order anything complicated, a Ham hash and a corned beef hash.  That's it, we didn't even substitute anything.  Seriously - all this stuff should have been prepped and ready to just throw together.

I don't know what they were doing in the kitchen but come on, this was completely unacceptable. 

The food at least came out piping hot, so at least we had that. I'm only giving it 2 stars because the food was decent, but nothing to write home about.

It wasn't too bad for the price, but when Egg and I is not too far away, I will never come here again.

It was inexpensive and good. Their juices come in a bottle so be ready for that, otherwise not bad. Not a smoke-filled atmosphere so that was nice.
The waitress was the only one in the place, so she was swamped, but we didn't feel totally neglected. There was a little wait for the food and my 8 year old did ask for the TV to be turned on, and she said the boss didn't want it on, which was kind of odd.
The jelly was so good. I got a jar of the mixed berry to take home.

Beingfrom SoCal, we were all about the buffets. But we thought my wife and I would try something different. Thus, logged on Yelp and found this place. Ordered and loved the Party Hash. My wife had the strawberry waffles and loved it. I tried their homemade jellies. Our server recommended the jalapeño jelly. Wow, she didn't disappoint! We will definitely come back and start skipping the breakfast buffets before hitting the casino tables.
Food was good. The jelly and jams were outstanding.  Service kinda sucked for being slow. Coffe never refilled and once food came out the next time we seen out server was with the check.

I really liked our food here. I had the meatloaf hash, and while it was a bit sweet, there was nothing a little ketchup couldn't improve upon. The raspberry roll was also good, but way too sweet for my personal tastes. They also have a variety of jams which are on offer, I tried the passionfruit but was not a fan (again, too sweet).

Service was good, but at noon she got a little busy, and when I say "she" I mean the only waitress working the whole place. We had a good 20 minute wait for the food to come out, which wasn't awesome. Overall, though, I'd come back here. The food was good, and if you can stomach a potential wait you'll be pleased with what comes out of the kitchen.

Yelp 100 Challenge * 82/100

Imagine entering your adorable grandma's kitchen; drapes on the windows, old pictures hung on the walls, homemade jams and sauces, fresh cut fruits, television in the background. It's definitely a cute place to start off the day with family but first, make sure you find it. 

Hash House lies along Decatur (cross street Sahara), just a couple of shops away from Aloha kitchen. It took my mom and me some time to find. Take note, if you're taking Sahara from the West, be sure to turn right before you hit Decatur. 

When we got there, Mary had us pick our own seats since there weren't a lot of customers. We ordered the Super Hash (ham, roast beef, poached chicken etc) with hash browns, 2 eggs and 2 whole wheat bread. Hash House's homemade ketchup was a nice added touch and their selection of jams was quite a variety! Breakfast was decent but not special otherwise. 

My mom and I love to experiment with new recipes every so often and ladies, what they have on their menu is not something you can't put together. I applaud the staff for keeping the restaurant in check and orderly, but I also believe that a restaurant should deserve more recognition if it offers something new, unique and exotic. This place may be a nice change from Denny's or IHOP although it's not one to repeat a lot.

Mary is the king of breakfast. She has the HASH that will bring back memories. Her food is always fresh and well portioned. The major deal maker for this ultimate vegas breakfast is the Homemade Jelly, Apple butter is out of control. You can even purchase most of all the jellys to go in a nice mason Jar.

Over all 10 out of 10

Must try

better than any other Vegas brakfast joint.

A local Gem
If u get there early n are lucky enough make sure u ask for the homemade cinnamon bun right away, it's on point.  All the food is good n even when back the following week to try the carrot cake.

My sister suggested this place to us because of their lobster benne's .  I'm a big fan of Benedicts so of course I was eager to try this.  The restaurant is situated in a plaza that doesn't seem populated much.  I actually passed it while trying to find it.  The place is outdated and we literally sat on a folding picnic table since there was 6 of us.  Not sure why they couldn't push 2 four seater tables together.  I ordered the lobster benne with hash browns on the side.  My son had a short stack.  My sister decided to try some salmon dish for the first time with a side of their special white toast.  Apparent their white toast melts in your mouth.  This place also makes their own jams.  The waitress came out with a tray full of the different jams (pineapple, jalapeño, watermelon, apricot, grape and strawberry).  You can try as many as you like.  The food eventually came out and I must say the presentation was visually appealing.  After a few bits in, it seemed to get bland.  I added pepper since I never add salt to my food.. But that didn't solve it. The hollandaise sauce was bland.  I slowly gravitated to the lobster only and left behind the biscuit and sauce.  The hash browns were ordinary.  I did try the white toast with the grape jam and that was delicious.  Overall, it's ok.. Wouldn't drive across town to eat here but would recommend it if you want to try a mom and pop place.

Service was a little slow. Sat there about 8 minutes before they asked what we wanted to drink. After that though, it flew! Food was ready quickly and came out pipping hot.

The Sage Chicken and Waffles were worth the trip from the Strip. Wife and MIL shared a hash skillet that they oo'd and ahh'd over. The kid ate a chocolate-chip pancake and smiled the whole time.

Pricey, but delicious.
Great place to eat .. Hidden Gem!! We will be back for sure :) Homemade Jam and Jelly is spectacular!!

This place is the best breakfast place, my comfort place to go too. BEST BREAKFAST IN A COZY NICE PLACE. OWNER CHIEF MARY the BEST CHIEF friendly environment and price is very reasonable just had grilled Salmon and it was very very good a place to go for easy fix. Thank you Mary.

Mary must be (more) famous for her breakfasts than her lunches because there were only two other tables occupied when we sat down at a little past noon.  We ordered cups of soup, my wife = potato, me = spicy chicken.  The potato soup was curiously thin and my soup, though spicy as advertised, was light on flavor with a few pieces of chicken that likely were added immediately prior to serving.

Yum! happened by this place while looking for a breakfast spot that was not your typical Vegas buffet. They are in a stripmall but easy enough to find. Seated and told the specials by a friendly server. I got fresh squeezed OJ...delish. Breakfast was hot and fresh. comfort food, nothing fancy. I wish I could have tried more things but I was stuffed. The cinnamon rolls looked especially tempting.

Great family diner.  Everything is fresh and homemade.  Can't leave without trying the homemade jelly. Love the owner Mary is awesome. Great variety of different hashes. Sage sausage is made to order hand patted patty. Just enough sage and thyme.  Can't get enough of this place.

Ordered breakfast for the crew. Mary was really nice over the phone. I went in there and saw that she was running the entire place. Made me feel good to support a hardworking lady's business. Mary greeted me and she ensured I had everything I needed. The food was amazing... Seemed very home made. The place looks like your moms house... Very cozy and coffee fresh and ready to be served. The pancakes were amazing .... Wanting to go back already

Upon first entering, this place is 3/4 homemade charm and 1/4 mish mosh chic. A woman greets you with a smile; she has shoulder-length dark hair and is earnest to make you feel at home. There is another woman who is older who is not quite as friendly. The food is decently tasty - just doesn't have a "wow" factor. But the homemade cinnamon roll is a nice touch and the fresh, homemade jams are fun to try. The food is worth trying again if you're in the area, but you don't have to go out of your way.

We look forward to seeing Mary, Darlene and Martha on a weekly basis. This is one of our favorite breakfast places in town and have been coming here for years. Any hash is beyond amazing and everything taste like mom's cooking!  T

This is one of my favorite places to eat anywhere - it suits me and my tastes.

I usually get the Party Hash - the mix of flavors and the jalapeños are just great.  I get the eggs sunny side up, and sides of fruit and either grits or toast.  I especially enjoy the apple jalapeño jelly on the sourdough toast.

Multiple hash options, waffles, pancakes, biscuits and gravy - they have something for everyone.

It is not the fanciest place in town, and I like that.  Tucked away in a strip center at Sahara and Decatur.

The service is friendly.  We look forward to every trip here - this is our second day in a row to be here.

Give it a try - I think you will like it!!!

Woke up hungry and wanted to try something different and I've never had hash so I figured why not. It was a cute place. 

Coffee options are mild or strong and they have flavored creamers, which is always great. I got the party hash with all the meats because what better way to try it? It was good. I'm already planning on coming back with friends.

Whether you are a Vegas Local or someone visiting from out of town like I am, I would say you need to stop by Mary's Hash House for some delicious breakfast. She's known for her different Hashes including ones that even have Deaugustino Lobster(sp). Ive had the Biscuit and Gravy Special as well as the Meatloaf Hash. Both exceptional and I would say if you are hungry, on a budget or no, hit this place up when you are in Las Vegas. Worth the drive off the strip for sure. Locals need to make a stop by also. ENJOY !

We DID mistake this place as HHAGG. Clearly we've never been there. We realized that 1/2 way through our meal. 

Anyway, what we had was good. Pancakes, hashbrowns, and bacon were all good. My wife's veggie hash was reported as good although you'd have to tie me down to eat that crap. 

We'd go again buy don't live in LV and probably never will.
Wow! I'm so full!!! Can you say plenty portions friendly service @ a decent price! Well done Ms. Mary!

This place was a sore disappointment. After hearing about it on the Food Network and reading about it in Saveur magazine, you know this that this place makes the best hash in all of Vegas. When we finally got here due to confusion from the cab driver (he thought we wanted to go to Hash A Go Go), The place was hot and under staffed. We followed the sign and sat ourselves. There was no option to add bacon onto any dish, and I never got my toast that I thought came with my hash. It was just one lady that morning doing everything though, so maybe she forgot.

The hash themselves tasted like decent hash, nothing spectacular though, and I never tried any of their special jams since I had no toast.

Walk in and be transported to a mom and pop looking diner from the 1970s (based on the furniture and decor)!  We went for breakfast.  The food was good, but nothing really stood out as great.  They offer cooked grits on the menu.  I give them kudos for that as it is not a standard on breakfast menus in this city.  But the grits were not to my satisfaction even after adding salt and butter/margarine (I think they gave me a side of margarine; it didn't taste like butter).  There was one lady working the entire restaurant and there were about a dozen different tables to attend to.  Despite that, she worked frantically to keep up the pace.  She did great.  I just hope that's not the norm for her sake. She brings a silver tray of small plastic cups containing different samples of their jelly and jams.  The tray is kept in a refrigerated cooler by the register.  They sell their brand of jellies and jams from what I saw on a shelf, again, by the register.  It's a quaint breakfast joint and a nice alternative to a franchise breakfast restaurant.  Note:  As we were getting ready to leave, I noticed a lot of dust and dirt build up on the ceiling fan blades, the a/c filter return register inlet as well as the a/c outlet registers.  Hoping that's not the norm.  In the women's bathroom there is also some visual signs of wear that could do with some attention.  It reminded me of visiting a Grandparent's house.  Meaning that the decor is dated, there is visible signs of wear on the building, but there is a sense of calmness and warmth from the people inside, and the food is good.
This place is so good!  Way better than the rest. Fresh and EVERYTHING is homemade. Mary don't take no shortcuts.

This "hole in the wall" restaurant was a pleasant surprise.  You'll see a sign that reads, "Seat Yourself" the moment you walk in.  The restaurant tables were all occupied so I marched my little legs over to the bar where there was open seating!  Mary, the owner, immediately approached me after I sat down and wiped down the counter.  Very friendly woman!  

There are two options for coffee, medium roast and bold roast.  I couldn't help myself when it came to the refills and ended up downing 3 mugs worth!  Tried both brews and both hit the spot.  A variety of creamers are provided like french vanilla, hazelnut, and irish cream to name a few.

My brother and I split 3 dishes.

The Party Hash consisted of a nice variety of flavors.  The mixture of chicken, corned beef, ham and roast beef all worked well with the mixed veggies.  Some of the jalapeño slices had a real kick!  Fresh jalapeños are used so be warned if your tolerance for spicy food is low!  (4 stars)

The Corned Beef Hash was lacking in the meat department.  Not sure if this was an isolated incident or if that's normal, but the meat was definitely seasoned/cooked nicely!  This comes with your choice of eggs and I went with sunny side up!  Overall, not bad. (3.5 stars)

The Monte Cristo was my favorite dish above all!  The thin sliced ham and turkey is nice and juicy!  Gooey Swiss cheese... that speaks for itself.  This is served inside some sweet homemade bread (mmm... the hint of vanilla) which was fluffy on the inside and crispy on the outside!  For any first timers out there, picture French Toast meets Grilled Cheese.  You can approach this beast in 2 ways.  The first way would be to drizzle syrup on top and attack it with a fork/knife.  The second way would be to grab a slice with your hand and dip it into the syrup.  Call me a savage, but the second way should be the only option allowed. (5 stars)

Both plates of hash came with a choice of sides:

Fresh Fruit - I chuckled when I was brought out strawberries and bananas.  Not what I expected when I placed my order, but no complaints here.

Wheat Toast - The homemade bread was delicious!  This was purposely ordered as an excuse to try out the homemade jelly!  Tried the pumpkin and jalapeño which were both fantastic!  So fantastic that I actually bought a jar of both flavors (yes it's made and sold there)!

Homefries - This side was recommended by the server.  I was expecting french fries, so I was slightly disappointed... wish the server or the menu had provided a description.  My best attempt at describing this dish would be "steamed potato meets hash brown."  Hopefully the picture provided along with this review will help that description.  They were good, but nothing special.

This was my first, but definitely not my last visit.  The staff was very attentive and kind.  

P.S. Be warned that the wait time for food is a little on the long side!

Great place offering a delicious, hearty breakfast at a reasonable price.  And those fresh homemade jellies were amazing.  Plus, the staff was very pleasant, attentive and welcoming.  We felt like we were locals.  This is my favorite breakfast joint in Las Vegas.

This place is amazing! The food is delicious! The variety of cinnamon rolls and jelly are the best! Mary the owner and also the chef is so very friendly and came out at the end of our breakfast to thank us for dining in! A must-try place for breakfast, lunch and dinner!

This place deserves to be in the 5 star club. Looking from the outside in not to pleasing to the eye, but once in things change.....for the better. Everything is homemade and amazing. Our waitress was very nice and informative. She offered us a fresh cinnamon roll which of course we took, and it was off the charts delicious. Homemade salsas and jellies top off a fresh off the skillet meal. Decor nothing special, but don't let that turn you away. Good job guys. I'm not a big high roller in Vegas, but if I come through again I'm eating here. Highly recommend.

I read the reviews and sat in the parking lot for 15 minutes debating. I really wanted a waffle, thinking I would just be smart and order extra syrup, I could flag someone down for coffee, so I went in.
 I found a seat by the window, there were TWO other tables seated. The great haired (uh oh) waitress came over and Hi. I ordered a waffle, and coffee, she asked strong and I said strong. Ordered extra butter, syrup, creamer.
 She left and an older couple sat themselves, then 5 people came in and went to the back. My waffle arrived.... Wait, what? Less than five min? As she sat it down she said, and I quote "I thought I'd get it to you before I lose it. I HATE BIG GROUPS." Um... Sorry? She then told the older couple all about it, all about it. In detail. 
 I couldn't get more coffee, because after a pass through early on the owner was in back. No other people.
 I are my Uneventful Waffle with Amazingly Taste Free Syrup, and she brought the bill. They stand there, with a little machine they hand you, and stare as you put the tip amount in. Then give you the receipt. I'm pretty sure of myself most times but it was creepy.
 The parking lot was really big. I guess that brings it up to two stars.

Order some food for take out and it was really good. Sometimes take out is cold and just thrown together, this was not the case at Marys. I want to dine in next time and get the full experience. You can tell they put love into cooking the food. Can't wait to try again.

Soooooo.....my review 
Hell Yeah!!!  This place is awesome from the fresh homemade jelly to most tender most juiciest pork chops I've ever had(one thing a bit less on salt) crispy hash browns beautiful over medium eggs.  This place is great near the strip and services are very very friendly and on point...it's hidden jem so if ur GPS can't find it...it's next to a Hawaiian restaurant in ol circuit city Plaza right behind super pawn

Don't do it. I know, I know- the chef has been on Chopped. That's awesome, but the restaurant is not. The jelly selection is impressive (if not a little overwhelming), but the food is just...no. I ordered the corned beef hash and it had no flavor. I expected more than what looked like canned hash and tasted even worse. Could have been an off day, but I generally give places two tries because everyone can have a bad day; unfortunately for this establishment though, I'm not feeling that generous.

Waited about 10 minutes to be asked about our drinks. My sister got an iced coffee and she said it tasted like the jack in the box syrup coffee. Was never asked about refills or if she wanted water also. The server was the only one for the whole restaurant. We ordered and then waited another 30 minutes for the food. In the mean time she was walking around little ramekins of jelly because there wasn't any on the tables. We weren't asked about refills or wanting anything else in the mean time. I ordered a Belgian waffle that came out cold and hard. The batter used for the waffle was plain and flavorless. My sister ordered French toast, sticky bun style. It was also cold and hard. Tasted more like a cinnamon roll than French toast. Hash browns were very plain and nothing special. We chose this place because we wanted to get off the strip for breakfast food. Now I'm hungry and disappointed.

Got the biscuits and gravy and it was incredibly running, like they added too much water to it. The biscuit was hard and it seemed the waitress was having an overall horrible day. She was rude to the cooks and couldn't even bother to smile at us. I wanted to like it but overall it was a pretty horrible experience.

Incredible like homemade! The jellies are amazing. What a find!
I had an egg white spinach and asparagus omelet with Swiss cheese...incredible! We will definitely be back...

My friend recommended Hash House. I only realized it was the other Hash House afterwards. 

This place isn't bad, but nothing spectacular. I came here with the expectation that this place had enormous portions. When the food came, I was a bit disappointed in the size. 

The food itself is not bad. I got the CHICKEN HASH and it was pretty good. It came with two eggs and I got to choose two sides. I got the toast and fresh fruit with it. The fruit was strawberries and bananas. 

They have a variety of homemade jams and jellys. I tried the watermelon, apple jalepeno and peach. The peach jam was delicious!! There were real chunks of fresh fruit in there. The watermelon was a bit too sweet, tasted like a watermelon  jolly rancher. The apple jalepeno was interesting, but it was good. There wasn't much spice to it, but it was balanced pretty well. 

Service was good. A lot of locals come here, and the servers all knew them well. Overall, this place is a decent breakfast place.

We went here because of Yelp's 4 of 5 stars. It did not disappoint. If you want fancy smancy and portions that are too much for a healthy lifestyle keep on going. If you want a hot breakfast with killer choices of jam and tasty hash plates then this is your place.
Our service time was average and our waitress guided us since we were 1st timers.
My wife got biscuits and gravy with eggs and I tried the traditional hash. Her biscuits were a tad overdone but that would be the only negative. Also get yourself a cinnamon roll and try the jalapeno jam on your toast. 
We will put Mary's Hash House into our rotation.

First of all I KNOW ITS NOT HASH HOUSE A GO GO so sending me messages that say "your review is wrong because you went to someplace that you didn't know where you were" or something won't change my review...

Basically Decent food ... Bad service.

We sat down the restaurant was maybe 40% full. It took 15minutes for someone to show up and take our drink order (no fountain drinks.. only $1.40 cans of soda???)

It took another 15-20 mins for us to get the attention of our waitress. I finally had to send my son to search for her. She took our orders and dissapeared again.

When they brought the food (finally) it was really good. Everyone loved the homemade jellies. I had the super hash which has everything. It was a little dry but good.

So after being ignored for an hour and getting the absolute minimum service (the bus-lady helped us more.. she brought my forgotten toast) I tipped $7 on a $52 bill. The waitress looked at the tip line on the ticket and scowled... I don't want to get into a "how much to tip" battle, but if you give crappy service and then scowl at a ~15% tip then I'm done with you.

We won't be back
Best hash. I've never seen a selection quite like it. I had the roast lamb hash, very good I wish there was one back east. Great selection of home made jellies too.

After seeing so many fellow Yeeps visit this little restaurant off Sahara and Decatur in the old Circuit City strip mall Cesar Q and I decided to follow suit.

Sadly I've driven past this place a million and one times and did not even know it was there.  So thank you, Yelp!  We were greeted at the door by a lovely and FRIENDLY woman from Columbia.  She handed us 2 menus and said to sit wherever we'd like.  Not sure about the negative reviews about this place saying they were rude. They were nothing but friendly with us.

We looked over the menu and when our waitress could see we were ready she returned.  I ordered the original style corned beef hash and eggs minus green pepper as I don't like green pepper aftertaste.  I had to order toast because I wanted to try the homemade jam/jellies!  So so glad I did!  We ordered our typical water with lemon then I remembered reading that the coffee is great at this place.  We waved our gal down and asked for coffee.  She asked if we wanted it regular or strong!? I order regular and it was great! All the hype is for real, yo!  Soon after she brought a tray by with a huge selection of bomb ass jams/jellies. We tried the mixed berry and the raspberry.  Both were great but the raspberry was awesome!!! The hash was really good but I did feel it  was a bit to greasy for my liking.  The potatoes were crispy and great.  The eggs were light and fluffy.  

I'd say we will be back to try something else as the food was quality and the place comfortable.

Decided to move a little out of the overpriced Vegas Strip and was totally amazed! Went to the highly priced buffets to the low ball ones. Nothing compares to this place! I had the meatloaf hash and wasn't disappointed. It's a small mom and pop establishment who doesn't love those. Locals to tourist inside.

I was fortunate enough to try Mary's Hash House on my last trip to Las Vegas. 

I wanted both duck hash and corned beef hash for breakfast. The waitress was nice enough to give me duck hash & corned beef hash combo. 

Duck hash & corned beef hash: served with choice of two eggs, home fries & toast, both duck and corned beef hash were delicious. The duck hash was slightly crispy. I don't know the price of the combo, but corned beef hash is $9.50 and duck hash is $14.25. 

Fresh brewed coffee ($2.50): you have a choice of either bold roast or medium roast. The coffee was not bad. 

I loved the mismatched plate and mugs at the restaurant. 

Don't forget to try their jelly samples!! They have apple butter, apple jalapeño, watermelon, strawberry and grape. 

Hash selections:
Corned bef, chicken, ham, roast beef, lobster, turkey, roast lamb salmon, meatloaf, duck, and party (corned beef, ham, roast beef & chicken).

They also serve pancake, waffle, biscuit & gravy, fried chicken & waffle. 

Our waitress, Lily, was the best. This social butterfly is sweet, outgoing, quick, attentive, helpful and friendly. We asked for recommendations and she recommended both her favorites and most popular dishes. Thank you!

We even met the famous Mary. 
Who is Mary?
Mary, the owner of the restaurant, was on Chopped @ Food Network. 

Mary's restaurant is a diner type restaurant that serves homemade, delicious food with a twist. It's almost like eating at your aunt's house. 

4 stars!! I am a fan!

Mary's Hash House is yummylicious!!

We waited 37 minutes to get our food and our waitress was a miserable excuse of a server. Towards the end of our meal, my husband and I were in agreement - we hate our waitress. HATED her. Okay, so we came here on a Saturday morning around 11AM. We tried Eggs & I first, but they had a wait time of 25 minutes. I think if we just would've waited there instead, we'd have been much happier.

WAFFLE SPECIAL ($7.55): A Belgian waffle served with 2 eggs and 2 slices of bacon. Gave the husband my bacon, who thought they were pretty delish. The waffle wasn't anything special, nor were the eggs. Very underwhelming. 2/5

CHICKEN HASH ($8.45): Ordered with a side of fruit and 2 eggs. My husband said the dish was bland. According to the menu, the chicken is 'garlic-poached', but my husband didn't detect any garlic undertones. 2/5 

SERVICE: A white-haired woman with glasses greeted us as we walked in and seated us immediately. She was awesome. An older lady with short brown hair and no personality is what doomed our visit. When taking our food orders she walked up to the table and just stood there, silent. Finally, she mumbled "Need a moment?". We gave her our orders and she scurried away. She didn't interact with us until she brought some food to the table, which wasn't ours. She took the plates away and said "Oh I thought these were yours". Eons later, our food comes. Not once did she return to check up on us or offer refills. I would've liked more butter and syrup but seeing as how she avoided us, that never happened. Lady had a perpetual frown on her face. If you're not service oriented, you shouldn't be a waitress! Also, it irked me that the check wasn't itemized and that there weren't fountain drinks, only bottled cokes. 0/5

VIBE: Old-school breakfast diner complete with ceiling fans and box TVs.   

Worth a Return Visit?
Other waitresses seemed to be competent and friendly. We got the bad apple. The food was unimpressive and took waaay too long to arrive at our tables. There's a problem in the kitchen and a problem with service here.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #218

Items selected:

Coffee
Biscuit with Housemade Jam (Strawberry, Apple Butter)
Monte Cristo
Carrot Cake

Part of the local dining scene since 1994, long before San Diego import "Hash House A Go-Go" splashed down with gluttonous portions at no less than three separate spots, Mary's Hash House on Decatur had always been a place I intended to go and yet for whatever reason it was not until I realized the owner hailed from my home state of Ohio that I finally committed to an early morning visit, a 6:05 am arrival finding a pair of regulars already present amidst the cozy confines as Mary and one other tended both kitchen and front of house in the most pleasant of manners.  Perhaps the most homey of places I've found since relocating to Sin City with aged wood furniture beneath sturdy tables and papered walls decorated by assorted knick-knacks dotting the two rooms it was with hot coffee, medium or dark, plus a menu of farm fresh favorites that I was greeted and although nearly all of the hashes and griddled favorites sounded good it was to traditional favorites that I turned, the meal kicked off by a rustic slice of carrot cake with tangy cream cheese layered on just that morning as I awaited my main course.  Truly 'home-style' with everything made in-house and to order including breads, jams, and jellies it would be perhaps twenty minutes and three coffee top-offs before my primary plate would arrive but proving the adage that good things come to those who wait it was with stunning results when the Monte Cristo was delivered; a true golden fried version with ham, turkey, and Swiss sealed inside ready to be gilded by maple syrup for a perfect sweet meets savory bite trumping any version of the classic sandwich that I've found in Las Vegas to date - a golden buttermilk biscuit with two of nearly a dozen types of jam offered as an alternative to homefries or potatoes no less impressive and briefly making me long for the Midwest...though certainly not for the February weather.
...as with Mr Mama's, friendly little local place with incredibly average food...thought I would find refuge in the home made condiments they use, but even those were poorly executed...ouch...
EVERYTHING including the grits (I'm very picky when it comes to grits) was delish!!! This will be in our regular rotation!!!
Everything is good fresh you will not be disappointed. Mary is often there and greets the customers. Try the Homemade Sage sausage.  Generous helpings and so...

If I could give this place 2 1/2 stars, I would. The food itself is actually quite good. I had a ham steak with eggs, home fries and grits. The grits weren't good, but everything else was pretty tasty. The portions were pretty good for being around $10. Other people in my party ordered pancakes which were pretty good despite not coming with any other sides. 

The reason this place received the rating it did is because the service that we received was just terrible. For the place being half full, we expected our food to be ready within 10-12 minutes, which is standard for the industry. Really, cooking the food we ordered shouldn't have taken more than 5-7 minutes, but we did not receive our food until 35 minutes after we placed our order. Our water glasses were never refilled and our waitress never checked up on us while we were waiting for our food. 

Overall, it was a disappointing experience. Hoping to find a better breakfast place off the strip next time I'm in Vegas.

**Summary**
       - Homemade Jams - After you order, they bring a tray over with homemade jams inside jello shot cups. We each got two. From strawberry to pineapple to even jalapeno, these jams add a personal touch to your meal. They also sell the jams too.
       - Decor - The place is a mom and pop brunch place. You get what you get.
**Ordered**
       - $8.95 Party Hash - Corn beef, ham, roasted, beef, chicken in a hash. I had to get a hash since the place is called Hash House, but it wasn't anything special.
       - $8.50 Tuna Melt - Probably one of the best tuna melts I've had. The cheese was perfectly melted and the bread was amply buttered. I'm talking AMPLY. I wouldn't be surprised if Paula Deen were in the back.
**Recommendations**
       - I'd recommend this place if you're looking for a nice brunch place with a small town feel.

Delicious food, great prices, cozy atmosphere, nice employees - and they were featured on Food Network - so what more could I ask for?! lol No but seriously, they do have their own unique take to things regarding the menu. Yelp suggested this place and it definitely hit the hunger spot. They have so many options which I thought was great! Cant wait to come back and try something new. I had the Monte Cristo and my friend had the Avocado Melt. And their food portions are big so that's a bonus! Thank you

Mary's Hash House looks to have a fan base of regulars who stroll in the door every morning. They tend to sit in the main dining area, watch FOX News, and participate in friendly chit chat.

The food is hearty and the array of homemade jams are enticing. My experience was middle of the road. The Roasted Turkey and Avocado Omelet was fluffy and filled with chunks of white meat. Sandwiched in the fold was a white cheese. I am not sure what it was, probably Swiss because it was mild. Besides the two ingredients listed above, three slices of avocado adorned the top. Other than that, it was a bare of anything else. This observation is not a criticism. It is more of a complement, the omelet needed nothing else. Due to how juicy and well seasoned the poultry was the egg dish did not fall flat. All omelets and hash dishes come with two side dishes. Healthy options include cottage cheese and fruit. I got the grits and wheat toast. The former was magnificent with a little butter. The latter had way too much butter. I wish I knew so I could order it dry. The ample amounts of butter made the toast soggy. The two jams I tried were ok. The mixed berry was loose and runny. The sangria just does not translate well to jelly.

I sat in the quiet back room and dined alone. My choice to be by myself meant I didn't get checked up on and the check was dropped with my food.
Hash is bad ass. Jelly is awesome. Service is perfect.

This Sunday morning was mothers day, so we knew if we went out for breakfast it would be busy, and choosing the right place may be key in the amount of wait time we would endure.  Our timing was just right, as we walked in a table came up and we sat down, only to see the crowds begin.

Because they were busy, it took a while for the server to come take our order and it took even longer for the food to come.  I got a typical breakfast with scrabbled eggs, bacon and toast.  The best part of the meal was home made jams.  They bring around a tray of several different selections and let you choose, but you get only one choice. 

I got a mixed berry and it reminded me of the jams my grandmother had made, rich in color, berry flavor and texture was just right.  The jams and the price was just about the only thing special here, I would go back, but choose a less busier morning.

Not bad as diner food goes. Had eggs over easy & rye toast. Just wish the toast was browner than I received.

Not bad at all.

Short & Simple - service was beyond horrible, food quality was terrible and prices for the quantity were ridiculous!  Silverware was dirty and coffee tasted like tar...first and last time for us!  Waitresses and bus girl have terrible attitudes and look and act lazy!  Better off at Babycakes or Egg & I!  Bleh to Hash House!  Clean up your act!

The food was good, however our waitress was very short. She took our order and brought us our food. She never asked if we needed anything else. She left our check as soon as she brought the food and never came back. We wanted refills on our drinks and their house hot sauce but we were ignored. Sadly the service made our experience bad. Another waitress was pleasant we just were not lucky to have her.

Oh yeah!
What a great find. Not Hash House A Go Go but completely off the strip and local.
The hash was delicious and the jams were a nice touch.
I'll be back.

All I can say about Mary's Hash House is "A go go" somewhere, anywhere else.
The wife and I stopped by, and the place was busy. After reading all the awesome reviews here, we were excited to try it....

And after trying it, I started looking for Gordon Ramsay or Robert Irvine to see if they were there trying to save the place.....

We sat ourselves, and within a minute or two, one of the bus boys came over to get our drink order, and he only made one mistake, so, forgivable.
We waited about 15 minutes before our server stopped by to tell us she would be there in a few minutes......Ten minutes later she showed up. (unforgivable)

She took our order, we ordered the roast beef hash and the corned beef hash. One with home fries, the other with hash-browns. The order came with two eggs each.
My wife ordered over easy, and I ordered over medium. Hers eggs were perfect, mine, the yolks were nearly hard.

Now let's talk about the potatoes, her hash-browns were not seasoned, were barely cooked, and were very greasy. My home-fries, were abysmal. They were still raw in places, and again, zero seasoning, and lots o grease.

Hash...the raison d'etre for this place...I have one word, disgusting.
The roast beef....more like where's the beef? It looked and tasted like overcooked ground beef, not even the good stuff, no flavor other than grease, and again, I point out, over cooked.Where is the seasoning?

The Corned beef, people from the emerald isle would weep over how bad this was. It was DRIED OUT, and it looked and tasted like it was the last of what was left that was scraped together and dumped on a plate. No seasoning, and there was almost no meat in it at all.

At this point, our waitress came back and asked us how everything was and my wife told her it was horrible. Giving credit where credit is due, she did offer us the change to replace the food with something else. Here is where my wife once again proved she is smarter than I, she said no. I ordered a cheese burger. After the debacle with the hash-browns and home-fries, I declined french fries and asked for coleslaw.

About 15 minutes later, my burger arrived. It was cooked as ordered, but there is where the positivism ends. There was ZERO flavor or seasoning on the burger, and it was greasy as hell.The coleslaw was so sweet, I could only eat one bite.

After all was said and done, the only thing they charged me for was the burger and two cups of coffee. So I do give them credit for that, but the food was lousy and we won't be back.

Note: I did not mention the side of fruit my wife ordered that came with bruised strawberries....
Note II: When we arrived and we were waiting for our food, we noticed a lot of people leaving a lot of food behind, before trying to eat, we thought it was because of portion sizes, nope...Portion sizes are ok, food is just bad.

I don't see what the hype is about this place. While the food was good, it wasn't great, and it's breakfast, how can you mess that up? We tried two different hash dishes, eggs Mary and chicken fried steak and eggs. Hash was alright, nothing special. Eggs Mary was good but I've had better chicken fried steak and it was small. Our waitress was really good though and their homemade jellies are a nice touch. 
At least I can say I tried the place but for me, it's not worth the trek off the strip.
Going to make this short and simple. Mary's Hash House is top notch. Large portions of great food (breakfast).
Great food and good people serving it! Had to come back again before I leave. Third times a charm, thank you for the good food!

You're in Vegas. What better way to continue the gluttinous theme by eating breakfast at Hash House? I went here twice, two days in a row. Although I didn't get a heart attack, if I did, it would be okay. I wasn't very satisfied with my first day's choice of entree: a large food competition-worthy banana pancake. Our waiter kept raving about how awesome it would be, but I think there was just too much of that and not enough bacon and eggs on the side. The freshly squeezed orange juice was delightful though. I managed to pick at some other friends' foods, including Chicken and waffle (with bacon bits!) .The second day, I stuffed my face in a Chicken biscuit/mashed potatoes dish (sorry can't remember the name), which completely compensated for the okay breakfast the previous day. The servings here are so large, even if you share with another person. Definitely a go!
All time old school great breakfast spot. Having a breakfast meeting or with friends and family this is a must.

Great place to stop at. I didn't take pictures because we ate as soon as we got it. 
The turkey melt is amazing and so is the montecristo. 
Great service and the cinnamon bun appetizer is awesome, nice & warm.

We went to Hash House (not A Go Go) on purpose because it was the only restaurant in Las Vegas mentioned in Michael & Jane Stern's Roadfood book.  We had great service, delicious food (hash of course) and got to meet Mary herself!  She's such a neat person and even brought out her copy of the Savoire magazine that the restaurant was featured in recently.  We remarked afterward that you don't get to meet Bobby Flay, Emeril or Wolfgang Puck when you go their places.  We'll definitely recommend to anyone going to Vegas.

We were actually looking for Hash House a go go, but we stumbled across this anyway, and it was great!

Four of my family members stormed into this place and sat right down at a table at 10:30am on a Saturday morning. Those of you who don't understand, this is kickass in itself because 10:30 is when hangovers are waking up last night's drunks, and church is getting out. It's a terrible time to try to find food.....

ANYWAY, we all loaded up on coffee and to my delight of my mother, they offered not only decaf and regular, but also BOLD coffee. Nicely done. Downfall....they do not have actual cream for the coffees, only the non-refrigerated half and halfs.

The coffee was great, and then they brought out a cocktail tray of jellies to try. The jalapeño jelly was my favorite, but they had hoards of variety, and they sell them. I forgot to get some on the way out, but they were worthwhile to buy.

I ordered the party hash. Corned beef, ham, jalapeños, bell peppers, and a ton of other stuff that I drowned in the habanero sauce (that's really sweeter than hot), and it was literally one of the best breakfasts that I've eaten......ever (and I'm a huge breakfast fan and frequenter.)

I'd absolutely love to head here again, and I'm pretty sure that I will next time I'm in town.

Fair warning, you guys only have a few more months until I return, so you'd better fix that creamer issue and find some hotter peppers, or you'll be hearing about it. Thanks for the great meal though!

Down home cooking. Awesome menu. Hash, more hash and other great entrees too. Mary's wide selection of jams are yummy beyond belief. For sale in 8 oz. jars too. Service can be a bit slow, but worth the wait. Try Mary's. You won't be disappointed.

I like this place because it is like going to a friends and eating good food.  They have friendly service.  It is a simple no fuss mom and pop joint.  Nice quiet place for breakfast.

I always get the corned beef hash.  I like the corned beef hash because it has to be homemade.  This is easily the best corned beef hash I have ever had in Vegas.  They usually do a good job on basting my egg too. The breakfast comes with plenty of food. 

This is a nice little breakfast spot.
Back in Vegas and of course had to stop for breakfast.  This is always a good choice, but it looked as if the hash portions has gotten smaller.
Excellent food and service - I cannot recommend this place enough!

I love this place.  If I lived in Vegas still this would be my go to place for breakfast/brunch.  1st thing from what I can tell everything is pretty much made fresh.  I had the biscuits and gravy special.  The biscuit was so good and same thing with the Gravy.  A side of bacon and house fries... The other times I came here I had the western omelet.  My friend Vinny had the waffles and he said it was  "Really good".  

The location is on Decatur, and Sahara.  Its not a hole in the wall but it would be hard to spot off of the street.  Its in the closed down Circuit City center.  Mary herself has a very bubbly and interesting sense of humor.  The waitresses are pretty attentive and are always walking around passing out jelly samples for your toast.  I had strawberry and peach.  They even had jalapeño jelly...My friend vinny said it was good.  All in all I would definitely come here for breakfast.  Super good and fresh.

I always sat at the bar area around the TV but from what I can tell they are usually busy so get there early.

Love this place 
Have enjoyed Mary's wonderful homemade style cooking for years .
Always look forward to her daily specials 
And the seasonal Hatch chilli creations 
If your eating solo you can sit at the bar counte

Always  love to support the individual business owner 
Enjoy !!

Looks like I'm not the only one who mistook this place for "Hash House A Go Go."  Well, not me actually.  My uncles were in charge of choosing dining options for our Vegas trip.  So we stumbled upon this first.  At least I had the pleasure of dining at both places.   
Some items are pretty amazing and memorable, but I thought the majority was pretty disappointing.  So here is the breakdown of what we had to share with five people and what I thought of them.  
Greatness! - Homemade Jams and Jellies (especially the Apple-Jalapeno), Biscuits & Gravy w/ Homemade Sausage Patty, Triple Decker Turkey Bacon Sourdough Sandwich
Just OK - Party Hash (good with Tabasco and still better than "Hash House A Go Go")
Never Again -  Lamb Hash, Veggie Hash, Beef Barley Soup (really really bad...probably as good as canned)

For several months, my friend had been hyping up this mysterious breakfast restaurant that apparently had the best jam ever. We finally went together and it was very underwhelming to say the least.

FOOD
Everything was literally just okay and unremarkable. The jams we got to try were definitely good, but my expectations were too high and they unfortunately fell short.

SERVICE
Service was extremely slow and there was only one waitress for a nearly packed house. As a result, it took us a long time to even request the jams and I don't recall the lady smiling even once.

LOCATION
Very central and convenient location. Mary's obvious a local hole-in-the-wall type of place. Parking is plentiful.

Yelp 100 Challenge - 2016 [4/100]

Actually found this place by accident last week, was actually trying to go to the Hash House a Go Go that is off the strip, but being the unobservant person I am I read the name wrong ended up here.

We decided to give it a shot since we were all starving, initially I regretted the decision because it took forver for our order to be taken and the food to come, but once it did it was SO delicious and fresh! I really liked that if what you wanted was not already a combo on the menu they were willing to create a combo for you (i.e. instead of the 4 pancakes by themselves you could get 2 with whatever side). The waitress was really nice and continued to check on us throughout the meal. Everyone was pleased with their meal and while the portion size was not as large as HHGG the quality was much better.

Always yummy we love coming here to eat before we drive back to LA! 

The turkey and avocado omelette with hash browns is soooo good! 

Service here isn't "top notch" but it's super friendly :)

This is a hidden gem. No crowds no fluff just solid customizable breakfasts that taste real good and offer large size portions. Come here if your hungry and ask for Martha, she's the best friend of a hungry guy. Waffles are lite and delicious, French toast was vanilla flavored and sweet. Soooo good ! 

We will be back!!!!
Thank you for a great breakfast this morning Mary!   Great food and the jam is exceptional

Great breakfast spot if your tired of the strip. A lot of home made goodness there. Omelettes are great and so were the fresh cinnamon rolls. I wouldn't be surprised if she made her own jelly.  Plenty of parking and excepts CC.
The food was good. I had the roast beef hash...had to try the hash you know. Place was clean, service a bit on the slow side, and our waitress was efficient and witty.

I love this place so much!!! It's just a shame it's a little far from where I live. Great Food at a reasonable price, Great and friendly service, love the atmosphere of it all! I usually get the chicken hash, and for jellies; watermelon and passion fruit. So looking forward to coming back in the early mornings!!!

Lucked up on this Friendly warm place for breakfast.   The carrot cake is AMAZING, especially warmed slightly.  The portions are large and the food quality very good.  Happy we stopped on our way home to Portland

The food was good, and the jams as stated by others were great.  Service however was slow and the restaurant had a dated feel.

We waited roughly 10 minutes before our food and drink orders were taken.  I never had and offer or opportunity to ask for a refill of my coffee.  Additionally, when I went to the register to pay, another waitress looked at me, then walked off.  I waited another 5 minutes to pay with our waitress.

Seriously serious home cookin. Everything is a amazing. Usually a choice of 4 or more homemade jellies to choose from. Homemade sausage. What?! Yeppers homemade breakfast sausage. Everything to order. Been bringing my family here for years. Happy 20 years anniversary!!

Not my forte. Customer service needs improvement, we didn't get water refills or extra napkins. No one came to check up on us once we got our food. My grits were not fully cook. I will not go there ever again.
Solid service and even better food! The corn beef hash and the biscuits n gravy are amazing. Their homemade jams/jellies are super cute and delicious too. Off the strip with a super homey feel.

This place is a little hidden gem in Las Vegas. It looks a bit under rated upon first glance as it is pretty run down, and with folding tables. But don't let looks deceive you!

Our friend was looking for a place which served hash browns, and simple diner place for breakfast. We found this place on yelp, as Dennys had an extremely long wait everywhere in Vegas on a Sunday morning. This place is a bit informal (we waited about 10 minutes to seat ourselves). 

Prices were very reasonable - I shared strawberry waffles with my friend which came with a side of bacon and eggs. The entre was about $10.95, which is a great deal for breakfast - especially for two people. The portions are definitely large enough to share with a friend. My friends ordered the omelet and breakfast plates, and all loved their dishes. The breakfast plates came with sides of toast, which had about 20 different jam varieties to choose from. I also ordered some orange juice -which was extremely sweet and fresh squeezed, always a great plus from a diner.

This place has the best food. The sausage patty and the home fries are a must order. Of course you also need some of the homemade preserves. You have to try this place whether you are a local or a visitor. Everything is homemade and the owner/chef has been on chopped. Homemade cinnamon buns and everything you could ever want. I know that the biscuits and gravy are so good that they remind you of that good southern cooking. I frequent this place quite a few times through out the month. If you are looking for a good place for breakfast you can't miss with this place!

This place is about as good of a breakfast place as you'll find...anywhere! The lamb hash was delicious! The cinnamon rolls and sausage patty were exceptional! Highly recommend ditching the strip and getting with Hash House!

MUST TRY THIS PLACE. You are likely to meet Mary in person; she's absolutely delightful. Make sure you try a good selection of her homemade jam recipes. The best part, though, is the hash! The Party Hash is fantastic! This is just the perfect place. Great service, great prices, great coffee, GREAT FOOD. Anyone living near here or just visiting, you HAVE to come try it.

The service, coffee, eggs, and bacon were very good.  However, the biscuits were small, over done and the sausage gravy was watery and kind of tasteless.  I would come back, I just wouldn't have the biscuits and gravy.
This is my favorite breakfast spot. The food us great and the service is outstanding!

We usually go down the street for breakfast when in town, but they were crazy packed, so we decided to try something new, and I'm so glad we did!

The food here was AMAZING. Between the four of us, we had three different hashes and a monte cristo. Everyone cleaned their plates and was happily stuffed. 

The monte cristo was mine, and everyone sampled a bit and agreed it was great! Not too heavy on the batter, and fried just right. I loved the variety of homemade jellies, and the jalapeño jelly made a surprisingly delicious compliment to the monte cristo. 

Even the potato salad I got on the side was impressive. I mean, potato salad is potato salad, but I don't know why this one was so good!!

Service was quick and friendly too.

This is going to be our new go-to spot!

We stopped in because we saw Mary on Chopped and we were looking for a Brunch spot while in town. We were so impressed. Great service and the food was so on point. Hash was amazing. Cinnamon Roll French Toast was amazing. Mary even came out and met our family. Martha runs front of house and is amazing.

Super quaint mom and pop restaurant, located off the strip. Recommended for those who prefer a homey and cozy feel, as opposed to a chain hash restaurant. We only waited about 15 minutes to be seated BUT after we ordered our food- we waited about 1.5 hours until our food was actually served! At one point we were even debating on when to up and leave.

I suppose the delay was due to several factors:
- Only 3 servers were waiting tables
- 1 person cleaning tables and doing double duty as hostess. 
- Observed 2 kitchen chefs cooking

We had 2 orders of corned beef hash, a chicken hash and a bowl of tomato basil soup. The food was delicious! I really enjoyed the corned beef hash. The hostess also provided us with samples of homemade jam to go with our toast. There were several flavors: watermelon, guava, pineapple, raspberry amd strawberry. 

I would definitely come back again, if the wait was not as long. You can see that the servers were working really hard and they were always hustling. I would recommend for them to hire 1 or 2 more additional staff members. They definitely need the help.

Overall great food, but not for the person who is on the go, or in a time crunch. If the wait time between ordered food and served food was significantly less, I would have upped my rating to 4 stars.

So we decided to try a local place while on vacation in Las Vegas. Was prepared to be let down once again by another 4 star YELP rating as we have been soo many times in the past. It is good, but not great. Ordered the Roast Beef Hash, it is "Hash House" afterall.....and it was just lacking in flavor. Tried some Corned Beef Hash from another member of our party, and it was like night and day...stick with the Corned Beef. Eggs and potatoes pretty standard diner fare. The homemade jellies and sauces are a nice touch.   Good place for an off the strip breakfast.
